review: Grand opening day.  No banners, no specials...but 3 workers said excitedly it was their grand opening.  Same ole TGIF to me, just cleaner than most.  :) $17 Jack Daniels chicken & shrimp.  My 2 sides were the thick cut parm garlic fries & the tomato + mozzarella salad.  My 2 y/o easily finished off half my chicken which looked like 2/3 of a chicken breast.  The fries were wedges fried to a crisp & tossed in butter/garlic/parm.  Which initially sort of grossed me out because they come out saucy looking.  My hubs didn't like it but they grew on me.  The salad was a nice fresh change to usual salad offerings. The portions are not that great for the amount you pay but it could be my "America, f'yeah!" mentality.  They have a decent points program & I like their happy hour options & tvs:tables ratio.  I'll be back.  p.s.  LEAH is a great server if you get her.  Attentive & helpful & you can tell she was excited to be there!

Their food was pretty good. I had the Blue Cheese Stacked Burger, they were not stingy on the cheese. it's a little pricy, two burgers and an iced tea aren't worth 28 bucks +tip imo. It kinda bothered me that they use plastic cups to serve their beverages. The service was good but pretty slow, it seemed like their employees didn't have a sense of urgency. The tables seem a little too close together, I could hear both conversations going on next to me. Overall it wasn't bad, not sure if I'll go back or not.

Grand opening day, nov. 26. There was no wait, which was good. A lot of people, (employees) standing around the front sign in area, they all said the same thing as we walked in. I understand they are "trained" to welcome you, but c'mon, when the first person standing next to you says welcome to Fridays how many? And you answer "2",why do 2 more people need to ask you the same thing? Our waitress was "over the top" with her thumbs up gestures and saying the word "fantastic" after everything we ordered.  The food is super pricey for what you get. We ordered chips and salsa appetizer, just a handful of chips in the basket. When we asked for more they said they could give us more but they'd have to charge us for more salsa. We declined.  My husband had the jack Daniels chicken, it comes with two chicken breasts and a tiny little bit of sauce. When he asked for sauce the overly excited waitress told him there would be an extra charge. It was already $17 you'd think they could spare a teaspoon of the jack Daniels sauce on the jack Daniels chicken? Nope. Kinda did it for us. Chili"s down the street has 2 for $20 with endless chips and salsa, extras are no charge and they have many more  choices on the menu.  We won't be back Fridays. Sorry.

6 days open. Sunday night. Happy Hour all day Sunday. Marvelous menu... Drink menu is unbelievable...omg, the combinations were stunning. I want to come again and work my way down the menu.  Ordered the triple layer pastrami with sauerkraut and Heineken beer.. In iced glass.. Even on refills!  Had fruit, not fries.   Delicious.  Please don't come as I need a table next time!  Rhonda gave great and friendly service! Wife had dragon grilled chicken.  Was able to substitute vegetables for steamed rice. Got more than she expected! We will be back, and bring our friends too!

Service sucked! No seriously, everything we needed we had to ask for several times. So missing my service from my tgif near south coast plaza. Im sitting here thinking are they too good over there?, or is too bad of a service here. I have tgif every weekend, their loss it made sense to come here since its closer to my house but I'm willing to take the twenty minute drive to the Anton blvd. tgif.

We had very high expectations for this Fridays... Guess what very disappointed instead....the decor Is great!!!!! They had 5 different people standing at the front doing nothing but chatting... Then when we get seated the table was dirty, our waiter took forever to take our order... I ordered a beer and my gf ordered a soda and I got my beer delivered by 1 of the bartenders and my gf had to wait almost 10 mins b4 she got her soda.... They were not busy at the time and it took 45 mins to 1 hr b4 we got our food.... In that time no one asked how long have you been waiting for your food..... The best part wait for it..... One of the Managers was also standing at the front with the other 5 talking and not walking around the restaurant... Get this on the bottom of the bill it gives you options for tip amount....NOW THAT IS VERY TACKY AND CLASSY!!!!!!! The employees need to get there Shit together b4 I come back to this Fridays.....it was the worst service I have ever had!!!!! The sad part is the food is Great..... I also got a soda after my beer and it tasted like DIRTY WATER like the cup was washed in dirty water!!!!!    So if you want great food but the worst service you will ever get by all means go to this Fridays J

You can definitely tell they just opened. The servers and staff were extremely friendly but seemed flustered and forgot a lot of things. The layout was nice and the food was good. Same as all the other TGIFridays. I wish the prices were a little lower for what you get though. All in all it's a nice place to go out with friends and they have some good Happy Hour deals.  I will return again.

So I was so excited to come to this TGIF's as I saw it being build in the mall.  I went here after work with my boyfriend and our friends. The  atmosphere is really nice. The restaurant is huge, very clean, and nicely decorated. Sounds good right? NOPE. The service absolutely sucked. We were greeted at the door, and the greeter took us to be seated. I forgot his name but he was really nice! Then came our waiter.....he started off okay, but as the night went on, the service kept getting worse and worse. We ordered 2 appetizers, the spinach dip and the grande nachos. And for our entree meals we order a chicken plate and two steak plates. We also ordered the strawberry lemonade which was fantastic, but super pricy. They also basically filled the whole cup with crushed small ice so it was a rip off.($4 each + 50 cents for refill) We waited for about 45 minutes until our waiter came back, I believe his name was Paul. He told us he was sorry that we hadn't got our food yet and blah blah, and decided to go to the back and check.  Ten minutes later, our food finally came out after one hour, and to top it off my boyfriends order was wrong. He ordered a steak and overemphasized to our waiter that he wanted it extra well done, it came out medium-rare. One of the cooks brought it out with the older manager (he was a guy), and before setting the plate on the table the cook mentioned the steak was medium-rare, we told her we wanted it well-done and quickly after the manager corrected her saying it was well-done, just so we would take the plate.  The other manager came to our table (Ashley) and she was super nice and helpful. She gave my boyfriend the option of throwing his same steak on the grill or a brand new one. The only downside to the new one was that it would take another 20+ min, and after waiting for about an hour and a half now we just decided to take the old one.  Another twenty minutes went by and we finally got the steak and our appetizers. Ironic right? I thought appetizers came before the main meal. Anyways Ashley told us she would cover the appetizers, which in the end was no big deal since it was happy hour and appetizers are 50% off. the total was less than 8 dollars. After we finally got our meals, we had to ask Paul our waiter for refills on drinks and water and he only remembered one of our orders for a refill on lemonade. My boyfriend had to ask another waiter for water since our own waiter wouldn't bring it to us. We got the bill and the total was $70 after the appetizers were covered, for three plates and lemonades. SUCH A RIP OFF. Oh and our waiter had the balls to tell us to go online and take a survey, but don't mention any of the bad stuff that happened, or if we did, to just blame it on the kitchen, after all what happened. We spent 2.5+ hours at this place, by far the worst service I've had, never coming back, and I'm surprised we even had to pay for our meal.

The staff was very friendly. Our waitress, Barbara, was super sweet and knowledgeable. No problem with the service. However, the food was extremely extremely disappointing. It was a very very slow afternoon, maybe 10 or less tables in use. We ordered appetizers, pretzels and pot stickers. The pretzels were good but the pot stickers were cold and not even cooked all the way. I ordered a burger and fries and those came out luke-warm/cold. Not acceptable. Barbara offered to take it back but I hate sending food back so I ate half my burger and put the other in a box but I'll probably end up throwing that out. Casey also helped us by getting a box for our food and was very friendly. Its just the food is so disappointing. I was so excited to come here, but after today I'm not sure I'd return.

Ok we came here around 930 on a wed night, it wasn't too busy. There were groups of employees standing in various locations talking to each other... After about 15 minutes of waiting our server took our order. 2 appetizers  and a pork chop. They forgot one appetizer and It took about 30 minutes for the food to come and it tasted like it had sat under a heat lamp for about 10 minutes. After finishing it took about 15 minutes to get a box and the check. meanwhile, at least 4 different employees passed by to go talk to the employees who were already off, sitting in the booth behind us.  So to sum it up, they were over staffed forgetful and inattentive. Maybe it's because it's a new store, but any decent manager wouldn't allow a store to operate in this fashion.

Peachy Keen. Get it. Down home Punch. Get it. Jack Daniel's burger. Get it. I was hungry and cranky when we got here.  Drinks, meat, and more drinks please!  TGIF received plenty of poor reviews regarding service.  Thankfully our service was fantastic that night. ("That night" because I can't recall if it was Friday or Saturday coming here...) Food came out 30 min after ordering, which the manager, Ashley, thought was just wrong. She comped the burger.  Drinks were delicious but fell short on alcohol. That's where TGIF did not hit the 5 star mark.  Bartender was a little light on the alcohol which made our drinks taste juicy juicy, not alky alky. Our drinks tasted like Fruitopia. Who remembers Fruitopia drinks? WIth more time, this TGIF is on the right track towards being a great place to kick it. Especially for happy hour!

Wow, awesomely bad!!! Started off getting seated and ordering a beer....wait, wait wait, ok 10 mins later beer shows up, cool! Looking over the menu, the waiter stops by asks if I'm ready to order, yes I am. Sets the dirty dishes he is carrying on the table if front of me and takes my order, rad! Just keeps getting better! How can you screw up a burger you ask, just go to tgifridays, they figured it out. Ordered another beer when the burger showed up and by beer came after I finished eating, nice touch tgifridays! Another instance where I had a gift card so I used it, would never pay out of my pocket for horrible service and bad food. Get it together TGIFridays!

The only thing redeemable was the food. Unfortunately its whatever they feel like serving you. My daughter got french fries instead of oranges, my son got pickles he requested left off, they completely forgot my wifes soup, and could not tell me what I was drinking. Not to mention they couldn't get the bill right. I guarantee I will not be back.

This review is only for the happy hour. It's at the bar only btw.  I'm so glad there's a TGIF closer to me now! The closest one before was the one at the block. And the best part is, this one isn't crowded because not very many people know about it. I guess that's not good for the owner though... Happy hr prices are fairly cheap. My margarita was good and strong. 6 drinks for 3 people and 2 basket of fries came out to be $35.  That's awesome for a Friday night ! Service was good as well. I did find a potato tag in my basket of fries that said "best used by dec 18th 13" though... I just put that aside and kept on eating. At least I knew I wasn't eating expired potatoes. Lol! I should've brought it up to the waiter but I didn't feel like being a biatch. Will come back for happy hour !

This review is based solely on the service or lack there of. I walked into TGIF to buy a $25 gift card as a xmas gift around 11pm there was no one waiting to be seated nor a line "score" or so I thought. I talked to the hostess about the gift card and she seemed to have got the message across to whomever handles that. After waiting 15 min and then seeing a group of 2 walk in and then being seated I finally asked the hostess if someone was still getting that gift card, she looked at me as if she was experiencing deja vu. Guess what...they forgot even though I was the only person standing there this whole time, major fail. Never coming to this Fridays again that's for sure. This being a chain restaurant I'm sure the food and drinks taste the same as any other Fridays but this being my 1st impression at this new location it sure made a lasting one. I'll be sure to recommend the Fridays at the block of Orange.

I usually refrain from reviewing chain restaurants, but I decided to make an exception here because the bad reviews are written with injustice!...And also, I love TGIF. Maybe the yelp-hate is conjured up by the owner at Outback (located near there) or some other local restaurant? Lol  Either way, I for one am excited TGIF opened at Westminster mall because their happy hour is outrageously affordable and food is better than average--Come to the bar from 3-7pm or 10pm-close, Monday-Saturday, and you'll find tastefully good appetizers that are half off and heavy-handed drinks for under $5!  (This deal can also be found all-day on Sunday and isn't restricted to the bar.)   The one thing that isn't on the happy hour menu, but is a favorite of mine: The Jack Daniels Burger. The JD sauce has a whiskey taste that's subtle and veers more towards being sweet than anything, but the bacon, patty, and lettuce balance that out.  Perhaps sharing it with a friend is the best idea because people do say the sauce has a chemical like sweetness that's overwhelming, but I'm still a fan! For $10, I've had worse burgers.  Decor here is gorgeous and similar to Vegas.  I dislike how the TV's are placed, however, as they are a little too high.  Despite the negativity about it, the service for me was quick, smooth and friendly.  I'll definitely be back! ---- Conclusion: Thumbs up! Extra Notes: -Accepts credit card -Connected to Westminster Mall at the old Wendy's location -Happy Hour M-Saturday (3pm-7pm &10pm-close) Also, Sunday all day -Clean restrooms

Christopher our server was easy going and personable. The happy hour here isn't very impressive for drinks, but most of the appetizers are half off! I ordered Nachos Grande and my friend ordered Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Pasta. The food didn't take too long, but then again there weren't many people there at 3 pm. The nachos didn't look very appetizing and the chicken was cubed into tiny pieces. The tortilla chips were a bit harder than I liked and overall the dish lacked flavor. I had to ask for extra melted cheese on the side. One waiter told me it wasn't possible without taking my dish back and reheating the cheese, while another waiter said it was possible and that the cheese was already melted. It took maybe 10-15 minutes for me to get the melted cheese... My friend claimed his dish didn't taste the same and the portion was much smaller. I never had it at other chains so I wouldn't know. Overall, I wasn't very impressed with this location and won't be coming back.

What a horrible experience for us!  We received stale chips that could break your teeth, burnt breadsticks that looked petrified, waited forever for ice t and coffee, and even after our server repeated our order she still messed it up!  After all that we were overcharged on our bill.  Two other tables dining at the same time had to send food back to the kitchen. Spoke to the manager who made all sorts of excuses about new staff and the new store opening.  Well you've been open for over a month and obviously the manager is not managing the staff or watching the food going out to the tables.     I have written a letter to corporate, hopefully they do something before this place goes under.  Put a new management staff in and set the bar higher with experienced cooks and servers who know the industry.  What a shame!

Wow never did I think a place could be so bad. My wife and I went here to eat. Service sucked waited 30 minutes for r waiter. Another 45 minutes to get our food and when it came it was cold and tasted gross. Never again.....be aware don't make the same mistake.

I went here on 12/29/13 at 12 to have lunch with a friend. I wanted to try this new tgif out and it was an mistake. It was the worst TGIF I ever been too. First of all, I should have gave it one star, but since they didn't make us wait to be seat, so they get 2 stars. Long story short, we were ordering our food and it took like 30 minutes to come out. It was a Sunday, the restaurant was half empty, so it shouldn't take 30 to 35 minute to cook our food. Second, our server never bother to check in on us. I believe the only time he checked in on us is when he took our drinks order and our food order, that's about it. He also mess up my friends and my orders. I ordered french fries with my steak and he ended giving me some kind of potatoes wedges with melted cheese on it. I am not even sure if the server know what the difference between the two is. He also gave my friend a salad that has no dressing on it and lied that there is. Its the worst service I ever got from a TGIF. I seriously think they need to hired more experienced server for this location. Maybe then, their rating wouldn't be so low on yelp. Also don't get me wrong, I love TGIF, I been to the one at the outlet of orange and the one near South coast and they been gave me excellent service there. This location needs to learn from those two location to better serve their customers.

Food came out fast! Service was friendly!! Laura rocked! This place has real potential! The General Manager came by and said hi!! The only thing I may change is the bartender should smile more, she seemed like she was having a rocky start to her day. I'll be back!
Service was great sat at the bar... JASON was great very fast friendly and efficient.

First off the host is dumb. She would ask for everyone's name so she can seat them, so I got a little confused because she didn't ask for ours? Then I go up and ask her and she says she remembers I am "next" Funny thing is? When she seated other people he said their names. I mean I would like to be called on to take a seat. Not just "so are you ready?" So? You're going to so me and not say table for two "Cindy?!" But whatever. She is pathetic. I'm trying my best not to be mean.. Any who I am only giving a five star because our server Austin is super nice and friendly!! He basically made up for the imbecile host. He told us about the appetizers and what's best. I mean servers are supposed to anyways except Austin was so jolly and even said it with an accent!! It was too adorable! My girlfriend and I really like him. So you guys should ask for him! Great smile too! He will brighten your night. Other then the great service from Austin.. Ribs were delicious!
Great Drinks, Friendly Staff, n Great Food The wings were delicious n the steak & lobster was amazing :) ill definitely be back

Went here for an early dinner. So it wasn't too busy when we got there. But how does a place mess up a wedge salad twice to the same person on the same night. But they did and the steak was tough. But the spinach flatbread was pretty good. Don't think I'll be going to this TGIF again.

Happy hours are the best part of all! For the first American food chained restaurant open in Westminster city with pretty good affordable happy hour? THat is a deal! I'm writing this not because of good food, main part is because of injustice and ridiculous reviews of those people. "Stale chips that could break your teeth?" NEVER heard of this description before (maybe you should go to dentist check out your jaw, gums, and teeth then) I've had nacho grande and it's so tasty and worth the $$. Really? do you expect the chips to be soft then it would be call tortilla not tortilla chips! I would recommend JD Burger, Cajun pasta, Bruschetta pasta, Nacho grande and wings! they have best sauces of wings here!

Turned a beautiful evening into a NIGHTMARE. Horrible service, don't blame the waiter but everything went downhill after we placed the order. The Asian lady that delivered our food should not be working there. She should be fired. The manager did not even help out. I will never go to TGIF again, I have told all my friends about the incident too. Sorry TGIF you suck I will never have dinner there again thanks to Outback we were able to save the evening

this place is awesome!!!! i've literally been here 10+ times since it's opening. great service, great food prices, fun times, the best happy hour, open late, and all the football games to me equals 5 stars

First time at this location. I wasn't too happy with the service and food here. The restaurant wasn't busy and had ample staff walking around.  Boy, was the service slow! My first friend had ordered an extra appetizer (he had already ate before us) and my other friend and I had ordered two entrees. We finished our cheap looking entrees before the appetizer even showed up. Actually, it never came. So eventually, we canceled the appetizer. At the end of the night, our server was MIA and the canceled appetizer made it's way onto the bill.

Do not judge a book by it's cover. This place might be new but the service was incredibly horrible. my server didn't know it was happy hour, when asked what drink I would like, I told him what I wanted and he flat out said, "umm how do you spell that?" Seriously dude? How hard is it to spell Angry Orchard Cider?. Hahah  moving on, he also asked me where my birthday was on my I.D., forgot to give us all waters, forgot to give us the proper check with happy hour prices, forgot our appetizers, forgot my friend's beer... uggggh do i need to go on? To add insult to injury...some lady who was also seated in my waiter's section, yelled out to a bunch of servers chatting by the soda fountain machine/registers .."HELLO?! WHERE IS OUR SERVER? WE'VE BEEN WAITING FOR HIM TO TAKE OUR ORDER FOR 20 MINUTES?!"  I mean really? it's a wednesday afternoon ... there is no one here. come on -_- I would though give kuddos to the Hostesses. They were the only pleasant service I got there.

We went to this place on Friday sat at the bar service was ok ordered some some food sliders were good and the nachos was nothing but old bag of chips with some Xtra dry chicken cubs spoon when I asked if their is salsa for the nachos brought one small cup less then an ounce of salsa. So I wanted to watch the Super Bowl today and I thought this is the place no one will be their I wanted quiet all I care for is my beer that was good but got hungry so I ordered the sliders guess what the bun was ice cold and meat we barely  warm the server asked if it was good I told her the truth all i got Ooo sorry ..  I did not eat it and I paid for it. We'll live and learn last time for that place

definitely the nicest TGI Fridays I have ever been too. The happy hour was awesome and since its new it was kind of a hidden gem since it wasnt packed which is rare. I highly recommend checking this place out since the Bar looks like something out of an upscale Vegas Club. It also has a nice staff with Hakim being an awesome server. I would definitely go back to this place for late night drinks and happy hour on a friday night! There are also TV's everywhere so you wont miss anything and an outside patio with cool heaters.

By far this is the worst restaurant I have ever experience.  Our entrees came out before the appetizer, our waiter was no where to be found and the whole nightmare lasted 2 1/2 hours.  So just a fair warning to all you out there.

Came here for happy hour on Saturday.  Ordered some sliders ($1.50 each) & chicken nachos, which were half price.  I have to say I loved both!  Chicken was diced & tender & the sliders were deelish.  For drinks, I ordered the ultimate long island ice tea & a Dr. Fireball & I wasn't disappointed. Overall, I will start coming here for happy hour now.  It does get very busy after 6:00pm, but I got there a little early & sat in the bar.  Big shout out to our server, she was very attentive to us.

This place is great!  I usually go to the one at the block but seeing this one was new we decided to stop by.  The service was great!  Our waiter Josh was so attentive and friendly.  He kept checking up on us to see if we needed anything.  Food was good but our steak was really overcooked.  We were hesitate to tell our server because we didn't want to be "those customers."  We ended up telling him and he promptly got us a new one.  The manager even approached us very apologetic and offered us free dessert!  Overall food is like any other TGIF but the service was awesome!

I am glad this TGI Fridays opened up at Westmall.. I feel like it's really helping in bringing Westminster mall back to life.. Now onto the review. We came to this place for dinner awhile back to give it a try. The inside is really nice. I love the layout of it. Its spacious and big. Not to mention they offer  an awesome Happy hour menu. Check my tip for details on their Happy Hour.  Anyway, we really enjoyed our food. I felt like this location, their food was alot better than the location at the block. Maybe cause their not as busy, but either way food quality was much better. Bf and I told ourselves we would be back for their Happy Hour. So that we will do.

This last Friday night.. And Mustache Mike was bar-tending .... Horrible service .... Asked for a drink on the web menu , and said ... We don't have Hendricks .. Didn't offer to try to make it with a different gin , just walked away ... And then proceeded to say the the bar was a Flair Bar , and tried to pop a corona .... And broke the neck as it flew on the counter next to me ..:. This is the worst bartender ever !!! Why act like this is a 3 ring circus when you can't toss bottles like a pro does ..... What a joke !!!!!!!  Food is great , service sucked except the other girl bartender who actually tried !!!!

Happy Friday! And if you want a better Friday you need to come here! The food is delicious and the service is amazing. My sister, ordered Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp. My mom ordered, lobster tails and I ordered a half rack of ribs with a lobster tail and I am so sad that I finished it it was delicious and our server, Ricky (he's amazing) was just the nicest and the most polite server ever, honestly best I've ever had. It was my first time eating here too so it was a perfect experience. The atmosphere was great as well, did not have to wait that long and we felt completely welcomed.
Ordered steak. Spent half my time cutting away fat. Service ok. Busy atmosphere. Good for groups. Bar area with lots of screens.

THIS PLACE SUCKS BUTT. I went there with a few friends around 11 pm on a Sunday night. It was pretty dead, and a few tables. Our server was sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo­ooooooooooo slow. We waited for our drinks, our orders, our refills. I would understand if it was busy, but it was pretty dead. Never coming back here again.  Food was OK.

Lunch for two using 25% off table order coupon $48 Fairly new TGIF with decent food.  Came in during Happy Hour and were seated at a booth right away. Had a glass...or two of Oyster Bay Sav. Blanc at $4 each. Regular price is $9 each. Happy Hour pricing is only at the bar even though every table had a stand-ad with special HH prices.  I wasn't aware of this being seated in the "dining" area.  Austin, our cool server, was able to adjust the bill and told us just to request HH pricing prior to ordering. I'll keep that in mind. The entrees ordered were the Jack Daniel's Rib Eye $20.99 and JD Ribeye with Scampi $23.99 Both come with your choice of two sides.  Not a fan of the JD steak sauce but all was pretty good. I'd go back but only with a coupon.

I will start off by saying the host did greet us and give a time of wait.  It was not bad the wait. What was interesting was the girls next to us were bashing TGIF as I stood there. (1st bad sign). Then another patron calls the a manger and tells her that billed her cc twice.  (2nd bad sign).  I thought. (Mind bubble cloud) - well the restaurant is 1month new. It is working out the kinks. .  We proceed to sit.  Now I recall the spinach artichoke dip as being nothing less then stellar.  It arrives and it is a hot liquid mess.  It was more like soup.  While eating said spinach soup the table next to me calls over the manager.  Loud enough, the gent goes "there is really nothing you can do. The food was just bad and I don't think I will be coming back.  " (3rd bad sign) My wife's food arrives.  Chicken kabob. She suffers through one skewer. "I can't eat the rest."  It's was a charred chicken kabob.   The waitress does bring it to the cook who cooks a second one for her.  Actually an entire meal.  Ok, nice but here is the clincher.   The bill.    They brought it and I was floored.   43.00.  Two people and a kids meal.  What they did was charge my wife for a second meal and the take the second order of kabobs  off the bill.  All restaurants like this typically charge one fee for a drink and free refill.  Well that was not the case here.   The cost for strawberry lemonade is 3.99 each and a very shady "never  coming back convenience fee" of .49 per refill.  Absolutely floored.  Next stop. Corporate.

My family and I came here for the second time.  We all ordered the burgers with the bottomless fries.  I got the parmesan fries, mother with regular and grandma with sweet potato.  Our food arrived and I noticed I didn't get much fries so I ordered some seasoned.  My mother ordered the pamesan and we asked for ranch. When she repeated everything, I had to correct her.   So were sitting there for awhile and she forgot our ranch.  Later she comes back saying our fries were almost done. We reminded her about ranch and she runs off.  I tried my fries and it was under cooked.  My mothers fries were stale.  By the time I finished half of my burger,  the second batch of fries showed up.  Later the ranch. lol  When we were finished, my stomach started to hurt.  When we got home, my mothers stomach started to hurt as well.  Not sure if it was the grease or food poisoning.  But we were not happy campers. =(  If we do go back, were going when it's not a busy hour.  So hopefully the food will be cooked correctly and our waiter wont be forgetful. :p

We have been here quite a few times since they opened.  This place is awesome their wait time has not been long like other TGI Friday's but then again they are still pretty new. Thier service is great all the hosts/servers we have had are very attentive and nice.   We definitely recommend this place.

My wife and I went in here today for lunch at 11:30am. We walked in behind another couple. The hostess just took them away and left us standing there without saying anything. We waited for her to come back, as they decided to seat everyone at the furthest tables from the door. As we sat down our waitress was quick with drinks and service. We each order one of their lunch combos.  My wife and I both ordered the house petite salad, but with different dressings. As it came out it was full of the lettuce stems and barely, I mean barely, a tablespoon of dressing. I tried to spread it around, but over 50% of the lettuce did not even have a drop of sauce. Within 3 minutes our half sandwiches came out. The pictures in the menu showed fries and more to the meal. What we got was a large white plate with a small half sandwich on it. Not even worth the $7-$8. They looked so cheap and stingy.  Location: Clean and plenty of seating. Staff: Waitress friendly, hostess not so good. And one of them was on her phone hiding it below the railing so the cameras or manager wont see.  Food: Lack thereof. Sadly the kitchen is not keeping up to par. We will look somewhere else to spend our money.

Yummmmy!! I love this restaurant. They have reasonable prices for great tasting food. Especially the burgers. And whenever I come here, the service is good. Also, the location is good too because it is at the mall. After I finish eating, I go shopping and walk around the mall to digest.

I was really excited to try this TGI Friday's because it recently open and it's very close to home. It was a family dinner with my husband, daughter and sister. We got there at about 7:00 PM and the hostess was very pleasant and friendly, she informed me that the wait was about 30 minutes and took my phone number. They would text me when our table was ready. We walked over to the Target since the mall was closed for the evening. I got a text at 7:21 we walked back and were seated. Our waitress was terrible. She took our drinks 2 waters 1 coke and a chocolate milk for my daughter. Took her about 15 minutes to come back with the 2 waters and coke. No milk for my daughter. My husband had to ask for my daughter's chocolate milk. Waitress took our orders. We order the loaded potato skins appetizer, it took about 20 -25 minutes to come out. It was cold, the guy that brought it out didn't give us any plates or napkins.... -_- what are we suppose to do put it on the table? or stuff it all in our mouth? my the time we finished with the appetizer my daughter had to go to the bathroom. When we came back from the restroom the first thing she asked was "is our food here?" no hunny, it's still not here.  She then asked if we could just leave, that's terrible when a four year old notices how long our food is taking.  Our food finally shows up about 45 -50 minutes after ordering. It was not very warm and the portions were kind of on the small side. Worse to say, my order was incorrect I ordered the grilled shrimp and he brought out shrimp scampi, when I tell the waiter (because it wasn't our terrible waitress) that the shrimp he brought out was wrong, he say's that's the only grilled shrimp they have (no it's not- i have eaten at other Friday's before). Fine i don't argue any more- will eat it. Cut into my steak and it's bloody. I like my meat well done, I can eat it if there's a little pink but there was blood coming out of it. Gross!! My husband trades his steak with mine because we didn't want to wait again  for them too cook it. I would have probably taken another 30 minutes. -_- In the end it was terrible experience.  I was excited to try it because it's new and close to home. Next time, I would rather drive to the one in Orange because although they're always busy, their service is a million times better.

Thursday night-- March 27,2014... I was there with my friends for dinner. I was the first timer there. We were seated right away. We had a server/lead waiter name Ricky. Ricky is cool, the best, friendly, and fun to talk too. He comes and check with us how are we doing with our foods and drinks was. We always talked to the manager too. But, i forgot her name. she was very nice and we compliment Ricky. We felt very welcomed. For sure, my friends & I will definitely come back.

A lot of negative reviews on a great place. My wife and I love to go here to have a drink and some snacks and the occasional dinner. The people who work there are pleasant (but so are we) and the food is good. Never a bad experience out of ten or twelve visits. And we live close by so it's within walking distance.

Service is soooooooo slow. The place was about 25% full. Came on a Saturday afternoon.  Watched 2 dogs give birth and 3 have their rectum checked on their TV! Not what I want to see while eating. Food was just ok.

I went into this location over a week ago, after 10 pm, and after seating ourselves and grabbing our own menus from the host station, we waited 20 min for a server. No server ever came to our table. No one ever came to our table. They were continuously serving other tables, however. I also spoke to a manager by phone who didn't really care either and clearly just gave me the standard lip service. NEVER going back to this location again and you shouldn't either. They clearly don't care about their customers at all.

We decided to give this fairly new addition to the mall a try for dinner. We were seated promptly, but waited a veerrryyyy long time before anyone came to our table. Here's the quick version of our experience: * little brown flies flying around our table (I killed two, one got on my glass, and 5 or 6 kept buzzing around) * after an hour of waiting our dinner began to be delivered * my wife's chicken salad was missing the chicken... would take another 10 minutes to get it * my medium-well steak was rare (barely more than seared) Maybe we just came on a bad day, but we left.

The service was not great the server was not helpful last time we came. Ordered the mozzarella sticks and they we not crispy nor cheesy. They were cold and creamy but not cheesy gooey like most are . I brought it up to the server but she said they're meant to be like that. The sizzling shrimp was ok and the drink with sprite tasted mediocre. Not worth it!

Service here sucks!!!!!! Came in with a friend, practically empty...Waited to get seated, bar tender saw us looking around since we didn't know whether we sat ourselves or not. He looked straight at us and kept minding his business. Didn't get acknowledged by anyone, sat ourselves and had to walk up to the host stand and ask for our menus...At least our lovely blonde waiter was a gentleman and food was alright.

The food was good but tiny lunch portions. We came here when it opened and it seems like all portions are a lot smaller.  Also, I think the place was called "TGISaturdays" when we finally left. It took that long to get served. Not sure if I will be back.

It's a TGI Friday's chain restaurant, so I don't expect much. Nonetheless, the food was generally pretty tasty despite all of their plates being scaled-down, over-priced, over-seasoned, and then over-cooked. They do ask you if it is cooked properly, but it doesn't matter much when it's a bad cut of meat or some poorly prepped veggies. Drinks are good here, the food is alright, and the servers are often huffy or make faces at each other when you "aren't looking".

Bleeeek! I would not recommend going here for lunch! I ordered the Ahi tuna Crips. Good idea, not enough for 1 person let alone 2. FAIL... My gurl ordered the Chicken Cobb Salad and what she got was a Salad with a Chicken breast spilt in half on top, a boiled egg sliced in half and a strip of bacon cut in half and 3 cherry tomatoes. Last time I checked Cobb salad is chopped, every DAMN thing is chopped.  FAIL Ordered a to go box for a co worker and she threw the salad in the Trash because she said it stink. She first had to smell herself to make sure the  Funkus... Amunkus was not her! FAIL I tried to give you another chance.

Went here for my daughter's bday on April 8, a Tuesday. It was a slow night but at TGIF, it's suppose to always feel like Friday, or so I thought. Got a "it's always Monday" looking kinda waitress who was less than enthusiastic to serve us. When I told her it was my daughter's 3rd bday and if they could do anything special, she said, "there isn't many of us so it's not like we could really sing" hmmmm... She Said it right in front of my disappointed daughter. Anyhow, in the end, they did muster up a couple of people and sang the bday song but it ruined our experience and I sure as heck won't be going back to this TGIF.

I ordered fish and chips and the fish was burnt! It was obvious just by looking at it.How did they have the nerve to serve this? I gave it a bite and sure enough hard as a rock.The server was really nice though and apologized and so did the manager. They made a new one for me and to my surprise it was still burnt  omg I'm never coming back here

My husband and I came here for dinner and we had a really good time. We were greeted at the door got seated right away (lucky us I think) and our server was really good. We both got beers and nachos to start as we talked looked over the menu then we ordered our meals I got the black bean burger which was really REALLY freaking good! The flavor was I can't even describe it but let's just say my taste buds were dancing and and tummy was happy! My husband really enjoyed his meal too and his burger came with some Tennessee whiskey sauce which was amazeballs! Overall the food was really good and our server gave us great service he was friendly and engaging and on top of things what more could I ask for? Oh yeah and the price for both of our meals with drinks and appetizer was just right in my book!

I got the baby back ribs w/ shrimp & it was missing the onion rings . My boyfriend got the salmon & steak .. I like how they come out to check if the steak is cooked correct ( the steak was so delicious btw ) BUT what we didn't like was they didn't bring the a1 sauce until we were ready to leave & the steak was already cold .. Our server was Ashley & she was missing most of the time , I feel like we got better service from Charles who came out of nowhere after seeing me looking around .

Stay away from the waitress jaymie!!Everything about this location is terrible. The service is slow, the food is gross and the waitress was even worse. My friend ordered a tequila drink and she brought out a vodka drink and tried to argue with my friend about it when she confronted our waitress. Then I ordered the steak fries and she brought out regular fries. Later on another waiter noticed the screw up and told us we could still keep the skinny fries. Later on our waitress (jaymie) tried to take them from us. Needles to say our experience was terrible

Long wait and skimped food. There were a few tables that left who were there before we got seated. My party wanted to leave but we decided to give the place the benefit of the doubt, given its friday. I had to stop to write this review and say i've lost my appetite. And the rice sucks.

I don't even know why we came here. It was a Saturday night and I got off work pretty late so the bf and I decided on this place since it was close by and opened late. We just wanted to grab a bite to eat and a drink or two. Haven't been to a TGIF in a really long time and this was probably my second time. Thought I'd give it another go. Man oh man. Now I know why I haven't been here in so long...  We ordered the bleu cheese crumble burger, a chicken dish with some sweet teriyaki glaze, and a few mixed drinks. Both dishes were a total disappointment. I was really hungry but neither one tasted nearly edible. I was so bummed out. The burger patty was so dry and completely flavorless. The fries they gave us were old and stale also. They were probably sitting out for a long long time because they definitely did not taste fresh. Considering the price they charge for a burger, this was completely unacceptable. The chicken dish was just so blah. I love chicken but I couldn't even finish it even if I forced myself. The salsa did not even go along with it and the broccoli was wayy over cooked. It was just so soggy and tasted like baby food you didn't even need to chew it.  The only reason why I'm giving it two stars is because our waitress, whom I forgot her name, was a total sweetheart. She tended to our every need and checked up on us often with a great attitude.  I didn't remember the food tasting this horrible the first time around. We definitely won't be back though...

Lets just say that I would prefer any fast food joint over this place. Not only if the quality of the ingredients extremely poor, the cooks obviously don't know what they're doing. My burger had rotten lettuce and the beef patty tasted like sure salt. The fries were old and tasted like they were reheated. As for my girlfriends pasta, the chicken tasted like cardboard with some burnt taste. We honestly think their food could be contaminated as we both felt sick later that night. Never going back to this location.
Update your website. Your website and yelp says you are open until 2am on Sunday and you were closed at 12am. Plus, your sign says only "11am - ." Might need to finish that.

My family decided to go for lunch only to walk in to an empty restaurant, tables dirty, 3 servers for the entire restaurant.  Food: sub par, soggy shrimp, salty puck like cheeseburger wilted lettuce, charred onion (guess that's what you get when you asked for grilled onion). Inedible salty limp French fries. Asked for fruit received 2 strawberries, 6 mandarin oranges and 2T minced pineapple. Very very disappointing!! Server nice but no sense of urgency and had to bus his own tables.  Sat next to a dirty table got 40+ minutes Enjoy!!

Ok for the most part I like to always give a restaurant two times before I post anything. so I just finished the second visit, and well not so pleased. Ok both visits where after 7:00 pm once on Tuesday and on a Friday.  With both visits the place was about 1/2 to 3/4 full, so empty tables where in sight. After a 20 minute wait I did get seated in a table  that was open the whole time. Then when we tried to order food we where told they where where out of the queso dip. So two strikes. The first  time we where not told that the dip was unavailable until dinner showed up. So then we ordered soup. Ok 10 minutes later we get a ," o I am sorry we are out of that too" however, they did offer us a substitute.  Really what is the luck of that. So strike three! Over all the people are nice but service is slow to stay the least that is if you can get the to make you food. About the only thing that went right was at least the air conditioning was working.

Went here with my lady past 2 Mondays in a row after work around 10:30pm  the first time we went was great second time had the same guy helping us and he was awesome once again very pleased with this tgif service was good place was clean food was excellent! definitely recommend this tgif the one in orange I can care less for

today was my first time coming into this restaurant. first impression: "bleh". two couples came in after us but were seated first. the receptionist sucks.  our server was good. but while waiting for our food.. a bug was crawling on our table. just disgusting. i told the manager about it and he apologized. he gave us a free appetizer. but that was pretty much it. my food was alright, hubby is not too impress by his food. my 2 year old daughter only took one bite from her meal, she is not a picky eater, so i assume her food sucks.  one star for the whole experience. still gave the server a good tip thou. he did a good job but this place is just horrible. i would not recommend it to anyone.

How does this restaurant chain stay in business?  I've been there like 3 times in my life, NOT BY CHOICE, and every time, it sucks. This time, I didn't go, but thought... it's time to write a review.  My hub and son went there together when I was out of town... Here's what I'm hearing.... The ribs were dry and tasted like BAD beef jerkey.  The chicken was so small and thin that it looked like less than a kids portion.  The shrimp looked liked it was frozen battered shrimp They chose fries and salad for their sides.  The salad was so small, they were shocked and all it had on it was head lettuce, 1/4 piece of a cherry tomato and some grated cheese. All this took 35 min to get to the table and they were out the door for $53 + tip.  Seriously??   They said they'd never go back...well, I could have told them that, but when I asked my husband why he even considered it, he said the commercial looked ok.  Hello?  So much false advertisement on that commercial.  Ridic. This is a new restaurant in the local mall.  You'd "think" they'd try to impress us... but looks like not... There are so many 1-star ratings on this page alone.... and now I'm reading that it's dirty with bugs crawling around?  OMG...  Disgusting. Go away TGIF... Hopefully you'll be replaced with something edible SOON.

Terrible Food and plain bad service! I love TGI Fridays but this location is just  bad.. save your money save your time this place is no good. I got attitude from the person that delivered the food to my table. unpleasant service!

Decided to come here with a group of friends since it's Friday and we haven't been here in a long time and it was a new location in our area. We waited a very long time to get a server to take our order and once we did order it even took longer to get our appetizers. We ordered appetizers which came with chips that was very small in portion. As guys we are very hungry with big appetites. The server saw that we had no more chips to go with our spinach dip. So he said he would get more but, 15 mins pass by and we had to ask someone else! That person took only about 5 minutes to bring it out. Total of 20mins to get a side of chips. Total time to get our food was about 45mins. We are our food faster than waiting for it to come out. We saw 2 couples that were seated before us got up and leave because they were taking so long and did not acknowledge them! Save your time and save your money. This place is not where you want to be if you're trying to enjoy a Friday night out eating!

Me and my boyfriend went to TGIfridays on Thursday... the waitress we had made us feel like were inconvenience to her never smiled or bothered to follow up to see if we needed anything forgetting or orders even though hardly anyone was in there ...At the end of the meal she tried to show some personality and talk to us ...-too late.  If you're a bitch and make ppl feel uncomfortable I'm sure you can get a job at the Westminster TGIFridays. .. what a joke  Wanted to leave a penny tip to but not worth the bad juju lol

I came into TGI Fridays for dinner on a sunday. There was about a fifteen minute wait. I was seated but a waiter was not assigned to my table. I guess its because of poor communication. The table next to me had received their drinks before I even had a chance to order drinks. Service was slow. Drinks took a while to come out. My appetizers took even longer. The waiter noticed the shitty service so she tried to make it better. I generously gave it two stars. The food was  decent. Its for the quailty that I would expect at TGIF. Since I was constantly waiting for service, i conversed with the people at table to my left only to find out that I wasn't the only one with a bad dining experience. They were double charged.

Showed up 1 hour before happy hour. Many empty tables staring back at us. We get sat in the bar cool but could have we just been allowed to walk in and sit.  Then waitress shows up 15 minutes later and starts off by telling us happy hour is over. Food taste was ok quantity was a joke. I ordered ribs you would think for the price you would get more than 11 French fries as a side.  Yes that's right I counted them because so Darn few.  What a mistake ever trying this place Chili's  is far more superior.

I walked into the restaurant 1.5 hours before they closed and waited 5 minutes up front to be seated while waiters and waitresses kept passing me by pretending to be busy. I was then told by the host that since I was eating alone it would be faster if I ordered at the bar because the tables were for parties of 2 or more and the servers don't like that. Wow...really? In an restaurant with open tables everywhere I am forced to sit at the bar when I don't even drink because it's more convenient for the servers?  Against my better judgment at this point I sat at the bar and ordered my food with the bartender.  After waiting 15 minutes with no food in sight, and my water that never showed up probably because the bartender was very intrigued by the tipsy blond on the other side if the bar (who I think worked there) I decided to cancel my order and leave. Never again will I eat at this restaurant. It's not my first experience with bad service here; but it will be my last. Sorry to be so negative, I normally to to find something good to say...but for the restaurant I got nothing.
My table was dirty! No one bothered to help me! I felt so abandoned. Thanks TGI! No tips for you! Never coming back again.

So I went to this location twice. The first time was alright. No one really paid attention to us and we felt a bit left out and forgotten. It took a while for our food to come out and the server kept helping everyone out but us. Food was good though. The second time, the same thing happened. Except this time, we felt more left out than ever. The server were no where to be found and we didn't get to order until 20 min into our seating. Food took so long for them to be ready too!!!!!  I gave this a second try and didn't like it as much. The reason why i go here is because it is closer to my home compared to the one at the block.  But sometimes I do go the extra mile to the block just so I can get better service.

I'm giving this location 2 stars. Here is why. We checked yelp for their hours and it said they are open till 2 am. So we walked in around 11:20pm and the receptionist even ope ned the door for us. We didnt get sitted till 11:25pm. The moment we sat down she told us we have 5 minutes to order because the kitchen closes at 11:30 pm. Then we felt like our waiter was rushing. He gave us the plates for appetizers that aren't even cleaned properly. There were still some stuff on all the plates he gave us. The food he served was still pretty ok and he would still check on us to see if we need anything. So he was still cool. He was just pressed for time and so did we.  We could have left earlier but he already put our order so we decided to stay. My advice is to please let your customers know when you guys are closing, especially if there is an hour or 30mins left till closing time, so they can decide if they still want to eat there or not. Also, to not make them feel rush and get a so-so to bad service just because of the time.  Please change or update the right hours of your restaurant here on yelp to get the burden out of your waiters. Tsk tsk tsk

This location puts TGIF to shame! I've been here one too many times and I can definitely say tonight was my last visit. My experiences here were never that good, but the server we had today was just awful. She did not know how to multitask at all. She walked by our table so many times, but never took attention to our table (unless we waved our hands at her) because she was so occupied about that one table she was attending to. It took her a good 10 minutes to get our drinks, which were just water!! The food took forever to come out as well, which I already knew from coming here so many times, but I think the server was just so slow that it probably took her forever to ring in our orders, so the wait time to get our food was doubled. She didn't refill our drinks when they were empty, we had to ask the busser for our refills. Honestly, the only time she was quick was to drop and pick up our checks. I wouldn't have been so harsh on this review if I knew she had a lot of tables, but she only had 4. She had our table (of 4 people), one was paying out, the other table (of 2) just got their food, and the other table were her friends. How did I know they were her friends? Because she apparently had the time to stand there and talk and laugh with them so many times. The hostess was talking to them too, so I guess they're the coworkers. It's so sad that I'm able to observe all of this. It just shows how slow and awful the whole experience was. I've never given any server a $0 tip and she was the winner. I just had to. I made sure to tell her that her service sucked, so I really hope she gets better.

My family and I came here on a Saturday at around 2pm, so the restaurant was pretty empty. The hostess sat us in a far-off corner table even though we passed tons of empty booths that needed to be bused.  We sat at our table for 15 minutes before being acknowledged by a woman who offered to get our drinks and told us our waiter, Christian, would be right over to take our order. After sitting there for another 8 minutes the mysterious "Christian" never appeared.  Needless to say, we left and happily ended up at Outback.

This review is mostly about the service...or there lack of. I have been to this location 3 times already. The first time it was spot on. Second time, it took over 45 minutes from sitting down to get our food.  This last time though took the cake. I was in there with my niece and nephew after a good work out and was really hungry. After we got seated, it took another 15 minutes to get our order in. After the appetizer came out, I noticed that we had no napkins or utensils. Then my steak comes out but this time I ask for utensils. Minutes go by and still nothing to stab or cut my steak with. So we ask yet, another waiter for some utensils. Couple more minutes go by, still nothing. We then ask the hostess and she runs off, still nothing. It was a good 10 minutes of waiting till I finally got a knife and fork to eat my steak but by then I was eating the pasta with my bare hands. I was not going to wait for it to get COLD!   I will be avoiding this location from here on out. I love the food but the service is so bad I have to wonder if they are understaffed or really don't care.
I came in with my family and sat at the bar out server Amiee was awesome! She was a blast had a great time !

Yesterday my dad, my brother, his girlfriend and I went to to T.G.I. Friday's for my dad's birthday dinner. We had a great time and I left uncomfortablly full (my fault) not to mention all the leftovers we took home. Service was perfect, helful and courteous. Yje only thin was their credt card server went off line and we were told we might have to "go get cash from a ATM" But I still give them 5*'s and can't wait to go again.  Highly recommended by all 4 of us

My boyfriend and I were debating on a place to go watch the first NFL Thursday night football game. We ended up at the bar area here and I thought it would be packed but it was pretty empty. As a result, there was not a bad seat in the house to watch football (or the Angels Game that was playing on one of the TV). Plenty of TV's everywhere (even in the dining areas). Another plus is that they  extended their happy hours to accommodate the football season .. (check out my picture for the hours). Service was not bad here at all. Our server was very attentive and came to check up on us often.

I've never eaten anything here I didn't like and the service has always been great. I think maybe once there was a server that was kind if unjustifiably rushed but other than that customer service is great and they have awesome happy hour deals. All day happy hour on Sundays too! We come here probably a couple times a month and love it!

Lots of staff but service was on the slow side. Waiters and waitresses running by our table constantly except our waiter was not one of them. Happy hour food was decent but if up played even a little and brought a little faster Im sure we would have ordered twice as much. I like that this TGIFridays was more mellow on the eyes. It does not have a antique pawn shop feel as with many others. many MANY TVs so watching games here is a bonus. Place has a huge lay out but the few times Ive been they have never been more than a 1/3rd full, I hope they can get the place full,

OMG if I could give this place negative stars I freaking would. The entire establishment is a complete joke. The manager does nothing besides stand at the bar. One waiter is responsible for an entire happy hour crowd. The hostess is an emergency waitress who is expected to do a crap load of stuff. French fries is the last thing out to the table behind wings and 2 sliders. You have to walk up to get your own refills at a sit down resteraunt. If LeSean McCoy of the phillidelphia eagles came here he would expect 20 cents FROM this establishment. Only come here if you're poor and need cheap food

Normally I love coming here. Depending on what day of the week you come will depend on how your service is. Today's service was awful. Came with some girlfriends in the middle of the day and hardly ever saw our waiter...why? BECAUSE HES THE BARTENDER TOO. He paid more attention to the people who wanted alcohol more then  us. If you do come here do not sit in the booths next to the bar, you'll get ignored !

I have to admit , this location isn't as lively as the other locations I've been too. It is less crowded and the atmosphere isnt the same. The food we ordered was so so. The bbq chicken pizza came out lukewarm and the fries to our entree were a little soggy from the oil. Other than that , service was friendly but a bit slow.

went with my family the chicken and shrimp  was bland,watery and not pleasant looking. my son ordered the chicken tenders very skimpy and tasted weird. husband got shrimp cocktail and  sauce was too spicy . he also ordered clam chowder  worst then out of a can! i use to love the food at tgi Fridays, they just opened at the mall and i'll never eat there again! low quality& priced to high for what you get a very bad combination.

Went here for dinner on 9/28/14 and the service was horrible from the moment we ordered drinks to the moment the check was dropped off. Our server seemed as if she didn't even want to help us. We asked for some lemon with our water and she gave this long explanation as to why she is unable to get us any lemons. That explanation included "the bartenders would get mad at me". I'm not sure what their policy on lemon is but you would think that as a server you would do anything in your power to make sure that the guest is satisfied. As a former server myself, I understood that my tip depended on whether or not the guest is pleased with their experience. This server seemed to care more about her COWORKER being displeased with her than she did about providing a great dining experience.  The lemon issue was only the beginning. I could seriously go on and on about how horrible our experience was but that would just be a waste of my time. The bottomline is that the service was horrible and I don't plan on coming to this TGI Fridays again.  PS... Our server was a blonde female. Don't remember her name because she never even introduced herself.

Where do I start....first time here to check it out, this place is fairly new at the mall. Well my son is on a healthy diet so we ordered a chicken breast meal and they didn't have chicken, wtf...really !!!  Anyways it was downhill from there. The food took forever and we hardly saw our waitress. The only good thing is happy hour,  1/2 off certain appetizers.

Went there on September 19th to get a take out order. It took awhile to get it so had a beer while waiting. I asked for extra sauce for the burgers and no cheese on 1 for my son cant have cheese. I even asked before leaving if the order was correct. They assured me it was before I was ready to check it out for myself. I should not have believed them. For the order was wrong and did not give the extra sauce. When I got home I called and spoke with the Manager. He took my card number that I paid for and he said he would credit the bill for one of the meals and also my address so he could send me discount coupons. Well they did not credit my card and have not got a thing in the mail from them. And as far as the meal. It was not worth me fighting that parking lot to get a person in a management position to FULL OUT LIE TO ME. Will never recommend this Fridays to anyone. No worth a star.
I'm never ever going back to this TGIF! I went with my family here to have dinner and catch up and our waitress was so rude. Never ever ever going back!!!!!

My gf and I were just at this location sat. We got seated fast (it was pretty empty) anyhow we noticed a family and a couple sitting right in front of us. The table with the couple turned over to us and told us they had been waiting for over an hour and gave us a heads up to not stay. They finally brought out the food to them and it was a salad and a sandwich/burger.... Over an hour for that? The other table in front of us was a family they finished all the food they ordered but the queso dip they ordered never came out hahaha that was enough for us to leave. The Fridays at the block is always so busy but never takes that long for food.

We have attempted this place three times and each time it has been terrible. The first time we dined here we were just stared at by servers for 15 minutes, and when we went to find out what was going on it turned out no one knew who was taking our table.  The second time we dined here, our entrees came out before our appetizer, even though we had asked to make sure that we got the appetizer first (Does one really need to ask for this?) The last time, our server didn't even introduce himself and just came over and said "You ready?".  I didn't get my drink order (a canned ginger beer..) until -after- my entree was nearly done and I ordered it before our food came! I still had to pay for it, and he also tried to card me for it. If you aren't familiar with ginger beer, it is like a version of root beer. Completely non-alcoholic. Seems like their staff couldn't care less about their menu or their jobs.  Get it together, TGI Friday's.

Such a disappointment... place looked nice. Great happy hour prices.  But 3 mistakes on the food we ordered was a disaster. I went from being hungry to being annoyed. Sent back 3 things. Really!? It's bar food...how could it be messed up that bad... wow!

DONT GO HERE!!!!!! I would give a less than 1 star if I could!! Worst Fridays ever. Gave them chance after chance. They are slow and treat customers like dirt. Every bartender is rude. I WILL NEVER GIVE THEM BUSINESS AGAIN!!

Worst restaurant service ever. later at night when me and my coworkers would get off of work and head over to this location its always slow even though staff are sitting and talking to each other. lIterally have to go to the hostess and say weve been waiting 30 minutes to order whats going on. Anoother 40 minutes to get our food. Another 30 minutes to get our replacement food because they always fuck up someones order and another 50 minutes to get the fucking bill. which we have to scream HEY WE NEED THE BILL ive almost walked out saying hey they clearly dont want my money since they havent come to collect it and i clearly finished eating 30 minutes ago. We never get refills. So fuck this place. I hope it closes down.

Customer service is ridiculous if it were possible I would leave no stars.  She asked us continuously what our order was and I thought that was nice, but when we told her we weren't ready she got annoyed and never came back. This is probably one of the worst experiences I've ever had a restaurant. I will not be returning or recommending this place to anyone.

I ordered loaded potato skins to go. According to the menu it has cheese, bacon, green onions & sour cream. I paid 9.29 for potato skins, an extremely small amount of cheese, way too much bacon bits, no green onions and no sour cream, I'm glad I had green onions & sour cream at home, but if I'm going to pay for an overpriced appetizer I expect all the ingredients listed to be included.
Manager is inept.  Slowest service and unprofessional.  Food wasn't even hot.  Avoid this location.

Most of the time I call to make an order the seem confused, or they don't give me my order correct. It's very frustrating when your hungry and get your order wrong. This isn't like most tgif's this one is one of the worst ones.

This place must have got a new kitchen manager or chef! The food was amazing!!!! I ordered the Dragonfire Chicken entree and it was delicious and fresh! It wasn't lukewarm temperature so I knew it wasn't sitting around in the kitchen!  My boyfriend ordered spinach dip and it was amazing! Great consistency!  The sad thing is the waiter we had. He barely kept up with our table and forgot everything we asked for.  Needless to say, food upgraded- waiter/customer service downgraded.

Gave this place three opportunities to improve but it kept disappointing. The food at first was okay and it just got worse and worse. Today we order wings potato skins and mozzarella sticks as appetizers. The potato skins were much different than before, they were thick and squarish, had weird hardened cheese on them with a mere sprinkles of bacon. No chives or onions like before they didn't even look like potato skins. The mozzarella sticks were like clotted powdered cheese packed into a form; not even slightly gooey, none of that stretch with real mozzarella sticks have. The kids ribs we enjoyed as expected. The spicy chicken shrimp pasta was a no. The fettuccine was not even close to al dente, undercooked and stiff. You can clearly see how much butter and oil is in the Alfredo sauce. We also ordered fish and chips the fish was pretty much burnt and tasteless and the fries were waaaaay too salty. They only get two stars for today's server. Not coming back.

Recently came here this past Monday at 3pm. The service was extremely slow. Our server managed to always remember to bring what we wanted - but it took forever. The food runners were very, very rude might I add. Service wise, it was a horrible experience. Food wise, it was good.

Went to lunch today and had a mediocre experience. The friendly waiter and decent food is the only reason I am giving it 3 stars. Cons: - There was a 20-25 min wait even though 20% of tables were empty - They said they would text us when table was ready. Never got a text, we had to go ask when we would get a table. We were told then that they have been having issues with their system. - The table beside us was not cleared from previous guests the entire time we were there. - They forgot to bring our side of ranch twice - The appetizer came out after the entrees - Small portion of french fries with the entrees - The loaded potato skins were lacking in toppings Pros: - Nice waiter - Food came out fast - California club was great, lots of meat - Beef dip was good  - Didn't charge us for the appetizer due to the issues, without us asking
This location is a joke. Ribs were tough, baked potato was cold. And when we asked for another potato they were out. When they finally produced one it was chewy and inedible. Never again for $112.
The bartenders ate amazing and super attentive to their patrons. LOVE this place and have never, ever been disappointed

If I could give no stars I would we went there Monday for big football game service was slow everyone standing around talking that worked their talking about party they were going to after work no one table touched we were their for entire game saw what appeared to be a female manager who was more worried about her friends that sat at bar than anything else she came out of back several times to talk to those girls hugging putting arms around drinking beverage eating all the while never asking anyone else in the bar area if we were happy or satisfied very unprofessional turned sound off of the game before it was even over highly unsatisfied environment I have also worked in the restaurant industry for 25+ years along with the two people in my party who also work at restaurants not to mention the guy clearly over served at corner of bar who kept turning around trying to make conversation  he could not even walk to bathroom law suit waiting to happen.
What an amazing service staff. They accommodated us and Manager: Allen. Bartender: natalie and Valerie just made it awesome. Service was above and beyond. Great time.
I love coming here it's my favorite every one is super friendly. Pluses happy hour simply the best thank you Friday's

Have been there three times, while the food is amazing the CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE. Have had to wait 45 plus minutes AFTER finishing all of our food to receive the check. I even had to ask the manager for my check at one point. Very unattentive and careless, waiters only check on you a couple of times. Unless you have the patience of a saint I highly recommend going else where.
I have been here 3 times now and each time the food is bad the services worse. The wait staff is pleasant but very slow and just generally bad service. The food is terrible.

This is the worst place!!!!! Food is not fresh!!!!! Every item we had was cold!!!! Fries were re-heated! Burger was so-so! Server was ok! I would not bring my dog here!!!!! Stop turn around and do not enter!!!!!! Take your money elsewhere!

I should have read the reviews before I went here.  I will never go back, here is why: - they weren't that busy yet it took way too long for a server to acknowledge is - a lot of tables around us were empty but not cleaned from previous customer, apparently no one to bus the table except the server.  Visually unpleasing - food.  Nasty.  All pre packaged/pre frozen.  All they do is heat and assemble. Kids pizza wasn't very good.   - I ordered the meatball appetizers which was smothered in cheese so you can't actually notice the frozen and heated up meatballs underneath.  Sent it back, couldn't even take a bite.  At least the server refunded me which is the only reason they get 1 star.  - thankfully I ordered the salad which was just ok. The crusted chicken also looked just ok and the crust wasn't good, go for grilled if you must to avoid theses pre-made foods This restaurant feels more like fast food, better off eatting at the food court next time.

Had lunch their today. The food was normal. Your basic quality  TGIF lunch. The French onion soup was excellent.  My dad ordered some sort of chicken salad with oranges and other produce.  The name of the salad slips my mind at the moment either way my dad really enjoyed it.  What made this lunch exceptional, was the service everyone from the hostess, the bartender who served us, to the expo, and a manager who is acting like a manager. He's helping expo food, table touching and generally aware of his whole staff and the floor too. Mind you it's slow when I ate there.  Most managers would be hiding in their office until it was a bit more busy, but not him.  I don't know his name. I wish I did though. Overall a great lunch experience today.

I usually love coming to Fridays, but this location is horrible. Service was extremely slow as well as the food. All we ordered were appetizers and a couple kids meals. Appetizers should not take 20 mins each especially when there's only 7 parties in the entire restaurant. The food was also overcooked, the flatbreads were burnt and tasted like tortilla chips, fries weren't as fresh. Overall I would never come back to this location.
This is the second time here in a 6 month period and yet they made the same mistake as they did the first time. This will be the last time I come here.

I've just finished scrolling through a ton of negative reviews on this Fridays, and I can't imagine how any of them could have happened.  Wifey and I eat here almost every Friday afternoon for the past 6 months, and we very rarely have anything but excellent food and service...busy or not. She gets the DragonFire Salmon with mixed veggies, and I get the Ribeye and Lobster tail, or just the Ribeye. It's always cooked perfectly, and I always have baked potato and onion rings as sides. Delicious!!  We have many favorite servers: Chris, Kathryn, and especially Sabrina. All three of them are excellent, and the many others we've had are very good as well.  It's tough to please everyone in the restaurant business, but they've always done very well by us. Personally, I would recommend this place to anyone.  ~Paul~

I wish I would have read the reviews before coming here. I'm only giving two stars because my meal was decent. Here's why I'm not happy with the customer service: The bartender comes around the bar and sits down next to me to take our order. First off, I've never been to a restaurant where the bartender is also the waiter. Secondly, the fact that he sat down next to me and proceeded to call my mother and I "honey" and "babe" while taking our order was completely unprofessional and left a disgusting feeling in the pit of my stomach throughout the entire lunch. My mother and I felt that he wouldn't stop staring at us while we waited for our food and then ate our lunch. The guy didn't even bring out our food and was too lazy to bring us the drinks he himself made for us. Waiter? Yea not really. So then after we were done it takes him 15 minutes to bring us our check. To make matters worse, he spent the next 15 minutes flirting with the hostess instead of picking up our check. My mother had to get up and bring the check TO HIM. Overall, okay food for me, my mother's food was awful, terrible customer service. Never coming here again. Don't know how this location is staying in business.

Slow service we had to wait to be seated even though there was empty tables. The reason? They were all dirty and no one walked out the door before us so thoes tables were dirty for a while. The food isn't hot when you get it.

I didn't have a bad experience. The waiter didn't come by often enough or cleaned up my table but initially he was very friendly and attentive and did refill my drink(though left the empty glass with the empty plates on my very small table).  I was seated right away and ordered a lunch combo and dessert. Dessert was amazing! I had the vanilla bean cheese cake. Huge portion, and two dollars off when you get a lunch special. Completely worth it. The bruschetta were not that good, would recommend a soup or salad instead with the combo.  Over all it was decent and I would go here again.
Love the happy hour! And hands down the absolute best mozzarella cheese sticks I've ever had!

Honestly the worst service I've ever had. Our waitress seemed afraid to come near our table. I asked for plates and one hostess ran away and got me ranch. I asked for plates again and our waitress ran away thinking that I needed cups. If you can't hear me or didn't understand me ASK ME WHAT I NEED. If you need clarification, ASK ME! My chips were stale, the flatbread looked like it was left out for an hour, there were flies over our table and one landed in my friend's half drunk wine glass. The attitude and the half assed customer service was horrendous. EDITED: I forgot to say that all of our food was slightly warm to cold and my chips were stale. And she had the audacity to not give us our change until we asked for it. EDITED 2: yes, my waitress spoke perfect English (I was asked that question). Also when she came up to our table she didn't introduce herself nor did she ask us how we were doing (not required but still it would've been nice) , she just hopped into asking us what we would like to drink.

This Fridays is actually pretty nice on the inside! Unfortunately, that's all there is to it :(. The customer service was so extremely poor! Our waitress had an attitude with us the entire time we were there. The few things we did ask for seemed to be such a headache for her (and we were very nice about everything,  btw).
