There were flies hovering our table (one landed in my drink), my friend's chips were stale, and the Flatbread I ordered looked like and tasted like it sat out for a good hour before it was brought to our table. We spoke with the manager to inform him on the horrible customer service we received and he seemed to take it seriously and offered us a discount in case we return....but I'm never going back!

Sat in the bar for happy hour on a Sunday. Good service. Nachos were ok but should have had more toppings.  Basket of French fries were good but my gosh they couldn't have been more skimpy on the amount of fries they gave us. Looked like half of what we were supposed to get. Stop eating them while you wait, servers. 2 Hanger double IPA and then 2 Bud Light for $3 during HH.  Our bill was $30 for those things... Pretty good.

Customer service got a bit slow after a bit. He definitely picked up the pace. Happy hour everyday definitely a plus. Yum to die for vanilla bean cheesecake; and there rib eye lobster dinner was good. Can't complain about the service in the end a+++.

3.5 I haven't been to Friday's in a LONGG TIME! My last few experiences were bad so I didn't think I would ever come back UNTIL... we were inside the mall and my sister as usual was hungry LOL, we decided to give it a try even though it was a Sunday afternoon there still was a good amount of people eating and around the bar area. We were seated quickly but it took FOREVER for our waitress to come and take our drink orders, another 15 minutes and she came back with our drinks, we ordered 3 appetizers: -Parmesan Meatballs (DELICIOUS! Flavorful and moist, it didn't taste like they were sitting out all day and dry)  -Potstickers: Just as good! Nicely seared and tasty! How can you mess up those!?  -Mac and Cheese balls: YUM! Crispy on the outside and cheesy on the inside!  All of the appetizers were delicious! I could have ordered more!  One thing that wasn't so good that was sent back was the clam chower! It tasted like canned mushroom soup! The soup had such a bad aftertaste! Our server was very overwhelmed with a lot of tables so things took a lot of time, drinks, food, etc. For this I blame management because Sunday is usually game day which means it is more busier! One waitress for 5 tables is not COOL! I hope the next time I come back the service is a bit better and faster!

This is the first bad review I give on Yelp, but dear god this restaurant needs help if it's going to stay in business.  Service: you need to train your service in hospitality manners. What we got from our server was a type of hurried and and as if we where bothering her manner. Only once did she smile. My husband and I dine out alot, this was the worst customer service reception I've ever gotten. I'm sure I'm not coming back to this location ever again. I was swatting at fruit flies while at the same time trying to eat.  The food: I would of graded it ok, but not anymore because my husband spent the night with stomach cramps and having diarrhea the whole night. That's why I had the need to write this review and warn other Yelpers of this T.G.I Fridays. Clearly this restaurant has very bad hygiene standards and poor customer service skills.

I'm telling you these Fridays, Chilis and Applebee's commercials have me coming in to try their revamped menus!!!!     So the family and I were at the Westminster mall and after shopping we wanted something to eat, my sister mentioned the food court and I looked at her nutso, I said we always wanted to try this Fridays since it looked nice, especially for being within the mall. So we come in and we sit in a large booth. Since we were seated in the bar area we had some happy hour options to choose from if wanted. Our waitress was a nice person BUT she was OVERWORKED and understaffed for her area. There was a table of 3 and one of the guys in the party was taking so much of her time. I shit you not, he asked about every damn item on the menu and pretty much ordered the whole menu as well!!! He truly kept her from helping 6 to 7 other tables. What a dick he was, you're not the only muthafucka in here trying to eat!!!!!    Finally we put in our drink order. I ordered one of those crack sounding sangrias and my mother and sister ordered their usual non alchy iced teas. So we look over the menu and there are so many damn options! A million appetizers , entrees and just when you think you're done there inside the folds of the menu they have seafood now. Lookin like a Red lobster. We ordered a few things Pan seared pot stickers Bacon mac and cheese bites Parmesan meatballs Crab Cakes Shrimp cocktail Dinner salad Clam chowder   So everything was satisfying BUT the clam chowder. It was HOOOOOOORRRRRRIBLE! Shit was out of a can and wasn't even the right can, it was like can Cream of mushroom!!!!!!!! I told the kind waitress we love everything but the soup is just bad! I never send food back but this was so fucked up on so many clam chowder levels. The founder of this classic would be rolling over in his grave! The crab cakes were TASTY but lukewarm and became cold if you did not eat them immediately. The crab to breading ratio was awesome. Very moist cake, just make sure you get them hot! My mom said the shrimp cocktail was your standard shrimp cocktail like you get at the grocery store. Fresh skrimps but nothing like what my mom had at Slapfish last week LOL. The star of the show for me  were the meatballs! Came sauced up and a nice shave of parmesan cheese. The meatballs were super moist and I truly thought I was eating them at a very good Italian eatery.     Besides the minor setbacks and delay in service, we still had an enjoyable time and we will come back to try the rest of the newer menu :) Plus I LOOOOVED my pear sangria, so that drink menu needs to be slayed!

Great service, awesome food. Our waitress Rachel is just so friendly, attentive and efficient! Cocktails were served in less then 5 mins. I will definitely be coming back since its my first time here! Perfect place to celebrate my birthday! Thanks guys!

I usually like this place for all of the good happy hour deals.  Well we went there a few weeks ago and ordered some drinks and appetizers. Well after I got home and the food had time to hit my stomach I was puking and pooping ALL night. Then i remembered why we hadn't gone there is such a long time and that was the same thing happened to me months ago. Bleh never again

This isn't my first time at this store, but this is my first review for this store, late; my apologies.  So let's get to business.  As we all know that this name TGIF was not born last night, they have been around.  I have been to TGIF and Chili's as well, they both have the same approach; fast paced and serve vast of recipes on the menu.  Another way to put it, ample of selections on the menu, redundancy enough? Hehe, at least to me. I like the flat bread pizza that TGIF offers, tastes better than from Chili's in my opinion, you can have a different point of view regarding that.  No words to say or speak of this establishment.  We have heard enough and TGIF is well established brand and also has a place in people's hearts.  Whenever I swing by TGIF, I will have the flat bread pizza first, the rest second.  Just my personal taste, FYI, I do not say other meals on the menu are bad. Will swing by TGIF from times to times, not on daily basis though.  Until next time Yelpers!  Catch ya'll on the flip side!
Typical chain restaurant.  Tons of money spent on location, furnishings, brand, menu and number of staff......then lost on indifferent service, bland dishes, high prices.  So not worth it.

Tgi Friday's has the best happy hour! Half off appetizers and $6 drinks/ margaritas! You can't go wrong with that. I'm happy they opened a location close by. No more long drives to Costa Mesa or Orange for tgi Fridays. I always come here late at night for happy hour. It's not that crowded on a week night, but it gets really busy on weekends. Service here is a little slow because they don't have a lot of servers, so be a little patient! Get a rewards card because you get points and unlimited chips and salsa. The chips and salsa is perfect for munchies with your drinks. You can also redeem food with your points!

Came here during happy hour which is also going on Saturdays too which is amazing.  It's a big restaurant and very pleasant atmosphere.  They have TVs all over the place and big booths and tables.  Servers seemed to me to be very friendly and attentive.  The food?  after seeing their menu, I thought their dishes looked very good and on the pricey side.  I know being in the mall calls for more over head and so on.  As for the drinks, they have a lot of domestic beers on tap and for a good price.  That is, if you drink beer.  Me, I like wine and the selection of wines here SUCKS!  This is why I didn't give more stars to my review.  I ordered the wings, sliders and a salad which were good and brought to me in a timely fashion by someone else other than our server.  Back to the wines.  All these wines are wines one can buy for $4.99 to $6.99 at any grocery store. Some people will be OK with these wines.  I just thought this restaurant for being in the mall, would have better wine selection.  So, my biggest complaint is only on the selection of wines.  This is why I gave 3 stars because I'll definitely will be back - just have something else other than wine!

Customer service is very important and this visit, it was not offered. Our server was so busy that we had to wait until the hostess had to ask for our drink requests. I order 2 margaritas for my wife and I and 2 strawberry lemonades for my kids. I asked a female server if we can take our order with her and she said in a bit because she isn't on the clock yet. While we were waiting for our drinks, the service wasn't coming to place our order. We decided to get up and leave. We couldn't wait much longer for our drinks and couldn't imagine how long it will take for our food to be order. There were so many servers standing in the entrance to the kitchen (assuming to wait to clock in).

First time to TGIF. We went there during happy hour. We ordered 3 Happy Hour Items and 4 drinks. The total with tip came out to $40. A family of 4 was stuffed! I think that this place has a great atmosphere. Its fun and lively. The food tasted good and the customer service was great. We will definitely be back soon.
Great service by Ryan/bryan(not sure about his name) the bartender. Very attentive and friendly
TGIF has awesome Jack Daniels short ribs that I would definitely come back for. There Jack Daniels sauce is amazing. Each time I place a take-out, the host is really friendly.   -ML

Tried this place out for the first time. The waitress was on top of her game and we didn't order any drinks but water. She brought a fresh glass right after we say it down. We just ordered from the appetizer as we just wanted a little bite. It was great to get 1/2 off and was a plus. ( score) she brought the 3 appetizers out and started to indulge. I quickly noticed in my nachos many burnt chips and was quick disappointed and wanted nothing more than the cook to come eat these burnt chips for me. They were topped with the chicken / cheese after the burn and very noticeable. I refuse to send food back as I don't trust my food coming back not tampered with. Really- burnt black chips!!!!!!!
The host here sucked different groups went in after us and got seated faster and with more people. Suckeddd the one by South coast is way better

Well considering we got our food 40 minutes from our arrival time, I had to give this place one star. I'm huge on service and the service was slow to say the least. My daughter didn't get her drink until way after the adults. Once our food arrived, the two adult meals were cold and my daughters food was warm. Maybe that was to make up for her missing drink? The server was nice, don't get me wrong. But the wait and cold food made my lunch experience an unpleasant one. Lastly, the guest behind me asked to get his food warmed, which was confirmation to me that I wasn't nitpicking. Good management would have come out and apologized for the food. Very disappointing. If you want a great overall experience, this is NOT the place to go.

I was having kind of a bad day and needed a little drink and something in my belly. Staci was our server and my gosh did she turn my whole day around. She had the sweetest personality and gave awesome suggestions on the menu. I'll definitely be coming back just for the amazing service!!!

The only reason we decided on TGI Friday's was because it was the closest place open at 11pm on Sunday night that we could find. Also, their fried green beans are our favorite. I ordered the bruschetta chicken pasta, or whatever it's called. However, I asked for no chicken since I'm vegetarian. The waiter mentioned that I could sub vegetables for the chicken, but I asked if I could sub a small side salad instead (in my mind that's no biggie because it's still vegetables). He went to ask his manager and came back asking what kind of dressing I wanted on my salad. Sweet vegetarian success!!! However, when the bill came and after we paid (our fault) we noticed that he charged us for the salad. I wasn't dying for a side salad of dried up lettuce that had probably been sitting around all day since it was almost closing time, so I wouldn't of gotten one if I knew it was going to be extra. It was only $2 and it was almost midnight so instead of going through the hassle of him refunding a mere $2 and some change to my credit card we just left. Point is, don't make it sound like I can sub the meat on my entree for a side salad when in reality you're just gonna charge me for it. Thanks Chris.

I don't usually post reviews,  but I want to save people from having to suffer! I have visited the TGI franchise all over the country.  It's always the same fun experience and quality food. I think I found the location corporate forgot!  The broccoli was old brown and crunchy.  The flat iron steak "well done" was more like  Jerkey and terrible.  The seats, tables, floors and booth lights were filthy!  It's worth the extra drive to go to another location! !!! Also when the food is left at the table,  and you need to flag down a different waiter for silverware because yours is no where around this is a problem! But I saw several tables having the same problem.
Ultimate Margarita was just the cool drink I needed in this heat. The Endless Apps got us nice & full

My friends and I love TGIF, but sadly earlier today we did not have a good experience.  One of my friends ordered the Jack Daniel's flat iron and ribs, and she had asked for her steak to be cooked medium rare.. well it came out super well-done!  The server took it back and had a new one cooked, and when she brought it out you could tell the cook stabbed through it because the juices came out!  But even then it was still cooked wrong because it was really rare!  We all are very disappointed in our service as well.  The server did not check on us or ask if my friend's steak tasted okay after the incident...especially when there was already something wrong at our table, you would think the server would be more concerned and make sure everything's good.  I mean if you want to keep customers, you really need to make sure they feel welcomed and cared for.  After we were done, we were thinking about ordering dessert, but then the server comes out and just drops off our bill.... so strange because all the TGI Friday's I've been to, the servers would ask if we want anything else or have room for dessert before giving us our bill.  And they weren't even busy, so there were no excuses :(
So far so good,  getting the endles apps. I usually stick to the usual.  Always a treat

My husband and I thought we would give this place another try since it is has been open for over a year, Well as you can see I still rate it as a 1 star and the only reason is because my chicken bruschetta pasta wasn't to bad. Really liked the balsamic glaze they use in it. It really tasted good together with the pasta and chicken.  Now on to why 1 star.  Drinks-My husband was smart and ordered a coke, can't go wrong with a simple coke. Wish I would of just ordered water. Instead I ordered a blended strawberry margarita. It came to the table looking really light pink almost looked like pink lemonade. I tried to take a drink and was met with a huge chunk of ice, so I used my straw and stirred it, tried again and still another chunk of ice. Mind you this was suppose to be "blended"! I told the waitress to take it back and have the bartender blend it again, as I am watching the bartender he adds MORE ICE to the blender pours me drink in it and blends it for literately 3 seconds pours it in my cup and brings it to me. I take a drink and another ice chunk and it was so watered down it was gross.  Waitress and Staff-Lets just say "Horrible", It was about 5:15pm and there was a few people in the restaurant. We sat in the bar area. We sat there for at least 10 mins after the hostess sat us before the waitress even acknowledged that we were there. She walked by us 3 times before that. She took our drink order and that took 10 mins just to get our drinks, another 15 mins goes by and she returns to take our order. 25 mins later our food comes out. My husbands plate you could look at the pasta and tell it had been sitting in the window for way to long. The waitress then came back 10 mins later and asked if we were okay, I asked does this pasta come with any garlic bread or anything? she says NO and walks away. REALLY!!! When we were done eating it took 15 mins for the waitress to even notice that we were done. Literally sat there with my husbands plate empty. When she finally came over I asked for a box, another 6 mins for a damn box!! Sent the check with my card and we wait again!! The waitress is off chatting with her co-workers and other parties. 12 mins later she decides to bring me my card and the receipt. During this whole time not once did the manager come by to see how we were doing, how the food was NOTHING!! But he walked by our table twice! I am not returning to this TGIF's again!

Worst experience!!  All the servers and the hostess in the place needs to go through service training again.  And again.  First, we walked in and there was a couple in front of us.  She did not acknowledge either of this, but took another party to be seated.  She came back, did not make eye contact with me, but ask if the couple would like to be seated.  I wonder err what else they could have been there for?  She walked very slowly there.  While she was gone, two waitstaff members came up to the hostess station.  Neither made eye contact with me or acknowledged my presence, even though I was standing right next to them.  Finally Miss Slow Poke comes back and says, "Oh, did you want to be seated?"  "Oh, yeah!  That would be great!"  I said.  She sat us down and told us our server would be right with us.  And that was it!  No one came back, no one took our drinks, waiters and waitresses walked by, no eye contact. Thank goodness that Jeremy the waiter was there on Friday to take care of us.  It was my second time back with my husband and the kids.  It was around peak hours that we stopped by around 430pm.  Got greeted and seated within five minutes, and  Jeremy our server WAS EXCEPTIONAL. he saved TGIF five more customers,  evidently I was here a couple months before when they first started their endless appetizers and I had the Worst service you could possibly imagine. Sarcastic,  almost dying tone,  no smiling,  straight face.  Waters were to be re filled when we were pretty much getting up and leaving, it was too late and he was no where to be found so we couldn't do the OVER HERE flag him down wave.  Jeremy thank you for your wonderful professional service to the family and I.  I'm in customer care myself so I know how difficult it is to keep a smile and also, multi ten other tables.  You are appreciated and I hope you saw that in my 20%tip. This location is TERRIBLE, really just the worst. Went there today to treat my sisters after a long week at school, big mistake. We arrived at 3pm and were seated immediately. There were about 10 other tables being occupied when we got there so it wasn't busy by any means. We waited 10 mins to get a drink order. Another 10 to get our drinks and order our food. One entree came out before the appetizer so my sister was forced to eat her food first. By the time the appetizer came out she was already done and she's a pretty slow eater. Then almost immediately the rest of the entrees came out which was annoying. That's when we stopped getting service. No refills, no one asked how the food was ( it was only ok). I go to restaurants like this to treat myself and do something special but when I left here I felt like it was just a huge waste of time and money. Would I ever come back? Hell no, unless I want horrible service and subpar food.

This place is your typical chain restaraunt bar at a mall. It's clean and predictable and the food really isn't too special but it is a fun place to meet up with friends which is what we did on our way to a roller skating rink in Fountain Valley. The servers and hostesses were very cute and friendly though and I definitely can't complain about that and the bartender was cool which is proabably what edges me over from a 3 star to a 4 star.

Food was perfect. Could not expect a more satisfying meal. Customer service not so great. It took 5 minutes before the hostess even walked over. She didn't make eye contact, and was really quiet. Not exactly a friendly face when you walk in. Our waiter was very bland as well. No conversation or anything. Just to the point- which isn't bad but makes me not want to tip as much.  Back to the food! Yum! I had the French dip and my bf had the Jack Daniel's flat iron steak with mashed potatoes and broccoli. He was one happy guy. The JD sauce was phenomenal! We finished with the vanilla bean cheese cake. Also wonderful. Highly recommend. Props to the chef!

First our server told us 1/2 off on all appetizers and then came back, Oh I'm sorry I was wrong thinking it was Sunday.  Then our drinks were wrong and had to be sent back.  When we got our food there was no ketchup on the table and had to wait to get the server's attention.  And the finale was our server forgot to give us our credit card back after we paid the bill and it was not noticed till after we got home.
Yeah, as the reviews regularly mention, this location SUCKS! Okay food, but HORRIBLE service. The manager should be ashamed. Who hires these people? Awful! Find another one or go to Outback!

WOW. I don't even know to begin with the WORST SERVICE I've ever gotten ANYWHERE. The manager was super apologetic about it. So we're on our way back from LA and as everyone knows traffic sucks. So we decided to stop and have dinner. We came to a mall, this tgif was clean as we walked in. Not too busy so we were seated right away. We ordered our drinks. And for some odd reason we got a server who just wasn't nice. Catherine was her name or at least that's what the bartender told me since she never even introduced herself. So we ordered drinks and then food shortly after. This location has been very inconsistent. Sometimes food and service has been awful, while other times everything has very good. Location is brand new and beautiful. They just can not seem to get on track.

Our food has always been prepared correctly and delivered in a timely manor. Seating wait has been right away.  We tend to eat here quite a bit, as we subscribe to the Strips.  Here is why I only gave 3 stars.  Many times, after leaving the restaurant and getting home about 10 minutes later.  I would go to input the information in to get more strips which results in free food.  Its like a rewards program.  However the strips would not work.  I would have to contact corporate customer service to see what is up.  They tell me that the points were already allocated to someone else.  How can that be, if I don't get the bill tell the end of the meal and it only takes me about 10 minutes to get home?  Well, it was reveled to me, by way of corporate, that the servers are stealing the information and assigning it to themselves so they can return and get free food for themselves and friends all the time.  They think that not everyone does the Stripes thing.  They may be right, but by me they have been busted.  Because corporate is now on to them.
In order to reopen after a power outage as promised in 30 min, they decided to let the customers wait in front of the restaurant for 1,5 hours without any notice. This is not how you treat customers!
Although it was 10 at night if felt like the sun was out inside so bring your sunglasses.  The waitress was great last night. .even stayed a little late and got no greef for it... food was good too!

Today our server was Christian!  He did an absolutely great job bringing us our food, bringing me fresh coffees and delivering service with a smile.  I am not sure why their overall Yelp score is 2 1/2 stars.  We had the Spinach dip appetizer which came out piping hot, Ribs and Shrimp.  The ribs were fall off the bone tender.  And chicken and shrimp pasta which was a tad spicy but yummy.  We were offered dessert but by the end of the meal were stuffed.  Again I can't say enough about Christian who did a great job keeping us happy.  This place is extra aweome when it is happy hour.  I goofed during my survey and clicked on "no outdoor seating".  They do in fact have outdoor seating.

Came to Fridays before heading to the Pumpkin Factory and pleasantly surprised by the great service my family and I received. We were greeted and seated very efficiently by Jessica and Matthew. Awesome to see when you first walk in. Then we were taken care of by Kevin. He was very attentive and super nice. He seemed to have every table under control and was quick to anticipate ones needs. Honestly, its great to have waiters who are this qualified. Will definitely make another trip back...

The service here used to not be so great. I guess ever since the manager maybe have read the reviews here on how the employees don't like their jobs that they hired new people or had a talk with them because for the first time last night, service was great. We did come very late so the service is pretty slow. However the servers were on top of it and assuring everything during the process.They definitely have improved since they first opened here.
Probably the worst service ever. Came here twice and both times they forget to put in our order or our order never is correct. The bartenders never pay attention to customers.
food is a 5 stars, server was a 3 stars, kinda slow but to his defense he was a little under the weather. Overall 4/5. Will be returning, and do recommend the location.

Eh. Customer service sucked. They took forever to pick up our bill. Home girl was passing us so many times and we were tryna grab her attention by raising our hands and all, but nope. Ain't no one wanna help us haha. We eventually paid, but wow. Service was whack.

Came in for lunch. I got the Friday's shrimp. It comes with fried shrimp and fries. I added a side of jack Daniels sauce for dip.  The food was delicious, the bartender was friendly and very fast greeting us and taking our order. Our food came out real quick and warm.  I've read some of the negative Yelp reviews and I had nothing but the opposite. It was very very good from the service to the food.  If you're looking for a fast & friendly place to eat DURING LUNCH, visit this location and see Troy.  Troy is AWESOME!!!
Their Friday's Shrimp is the best and their fries are so good. 2 for $20 dinner deal includes an appetizer and 2 entrees. Jocelyn is the best waitress!

If they have a ZERO star option, then I would've giving it to this location for there shitty decision.  Me and my buddy was super hungry and was thinking TGIF would satisfied our stomach. It's really shady how someone could LIED to us about something that they served and refuse to served us the deal on their menu.  Tsk Tsk Tsk

I went here because I had a bogo coupon! And I had great customer service. There was something wrong with my order and my server "Liz" just took it off the bill and also thanks to the manager but I had a great experience so far.  Thanks Liz
Love this place...the jack daniels sauce on the ribs are so bomb and everything on the menu as well

SLOW!  these guys make turtles look fast.  For a big chain this location needs help.  The food is usually on par with TGIF quality.  Cooked properly, and good tasting.  But the service here needs help.  I am a stripes member and used to travel a lot so TGIF is a common watering hole for me.  I hope the management staff here trains the staff better on how to watch tables and refill drinks quicker.  Every time I've been here I would say it take 10-15 minutes longer than expected just to get our food out to us.  And I've need had a drink refilled.  They couldn't even bring lemon for my water.

Worst service ever. Came in for a holiday work meeting & our server & the manager were extremely rude & unprofessional!!! I work in customer service & never have I ever had such worst customer service ! I don't feel at peace here.

My wife and I hadn't been to Westminster Mall since the early 90's. So many changes! But anyway, back to my TGIF experience. I'm not sure why this place has a low star rating. Our lunch was rather pleasant. My wife had the Lobster tails and I had the Bourbon Chicken. Both dishes were mouth watering. The only exception was the Mac-n-Cheese as it was a bit dry. Our server was a kind young man named Ryan. He was as friendly as they come. While the ambiance was nice, one thing that bugged me was a TV monitor showing a PBR show. Watching bulls jumping around slinging snotty slobber and beating up cowboys wasn't too appetizing. All in all not a bad lunch. Gary
The waiter greeted my boyfriend and I with, "what's up dudes? ready to order?" I'm obviously a girl! He then proceeded to talking to us as if we were his buddy.. So unprofessional!

Fantastic! Their portion is so big and filling :D we called the steak and lobster and they put the portion in 2 plates for sharing and that was really nice. Their siracha buffalo wings was very good. The strawberry passion fruit tea was very refreshing :)

During my first visit, everything was piping hot and absolutely delicious. Enjoyed my favorite sizzling skillet. The waitress was super nice and helped me earn my stripes even though I didn't have the card with me. LAST TIME, our table of 3 ordered the bottomless appetizers at $10 per person. We were all ready to take advantage of this, what seemed to be, awesome deal and ask the waitress to keep it coming, with expectations that the food would be good (or at least edible). Too bad they cut out the tacos from the endless app menu. We had to settle for the "loaded" potato skins minus the bacon, mozerella sticks, and boneless chicken wing things. Now for the chicken, they came in about 10 different flavors and we were told that you could swap out flavors any time. So we thought, "Cool. Let's do this." At first, she dropped off a plate of skins WITH bacon and didn't bother to stay for a second so I had to call her back and wait for her to bring another. When they finally came, they were DAMN GREASY! No other way to describe it. There was so much oil in the thing that it was, like, translucent. All it was was carved out pieces of unsalted frozen potato wedges with a square of disgusting, not even melted orange cheese on each. I know the request was without bacon, but that's because we had a vegetarian on the table who I planned to share with. They could've accommodated us by throwing on some green onions or at least some seasoning! About 6 came on the plate with a tiny sour cream cup to dip (so about 2 tablespoons of it). The mozerella sticks were disgusting. The cheese inside tasted like nothing and got stuck in our throats. They served it with a tiny cup of, I think, marinara sauce that was super overpowering. We chose buffalo for the flavor of our first batch of boneless chicken wings and it was not good at all and very much like frozen Tyson Anytizers. We were already expecting them to have plain chicken at hand to toss in sauce to order but, c'mon. They didn't even cook it with the sauce, which made the flavor and smell so acidic and vinegary. We requested for a bigger dipping cup of ranch to stomach it since the little 2 tablespoon cup did not suffice and she said she couldn't do that for us but promised to bring out more of those little dipping sauce containers. Our next batch of wings were BBQ flavor and AGAIN the sauce was not cooked with the chicken. With this one, we couldn't stand the smell. And where were those extra sauces we asked for? At this point, we were gasping for air and didn't have any water. Our waitress was nowhere in sight and it was a weekday with only about 15 other patrons beside us or less. We ended up eating a total of half a plate of skins, 1 plate of mozerella sticks, and 1 batch of wings and leaving without an appetite -not good! Big waste of our money. The only reason I paid for the shit service and revolting freezer food that was served to us was because I had a gift card.

Decided to try again. Before we went I checked online. Stated happy hour all day etc etc. uhh nope. I guess since it's a chain and you do internet searches tgi's server or host etc isn't as smart as a smart phone etc for location. They don't honor website promotions on the west coast because those are east coast promotions..... Didn't stay, just wanted a quick snack went elsewhere. Same review score. Prob should be less but I don't mind stopping in for a beer here and there.

Got to the mall early so we stopped in here for a little brunch. Food was alright...service was all right... nothing really moved me or made me want to come back. Bloody Marys were horrible. (You all know me and my Bloody Marys...) They had a great tap selection and for that I was kind on my star count review.

On 9/7/2015 I wrote this letter to their customer service department.  They did not respond.  I wrote to their Facebook page and they wrote that someone would contact me.  ( I gave them my telephone number and email.)  I wanted to give them a chance to make our dining experience right but no one ever reached out.  Here was my letter:  ~Just had a crummy experience at your Westminster Mall location! Arrived at 1pm for lunch and was greeted by a sullen hostess.  Once seated we waited to be greeted by our waiter, Austin.  When he came around my requested glass of water with lemon---it  was sans lemon.  Husband orders your endless apps and I ask for a few more minutes to decide.  Waiter shows up after 10 minutes.  Takes order.  LONG wait.  Get the French Dip which has rock hard bread and cold insides.  Ask politely if I can get something hot.  Hear Austin the waiter yelling at chef.  It's now been 45 minutes.  At an hour mark I get my entree which is now hot but the bread is pasty white and not toasted.  (I guess you can have it rock hard or totally cold.)  Opted for cole slaw which has not been dressed or seasoned.  Yuck. Austin is more annoyed than apologetic and nothing is offered for the over hour wait for a sandwich and a cold order.  I'd really appreciate a response back. I was not mean to any waitstaff nor did I ask for anything outrageous.  I write thank yous as well as not so great experiences.  I am sorry we will not be visiting TGI Fridays anymore.~ Wish I could give zero stars!

When there are so many options for me to choose from the menu, I get very indecisive on what to eat. Took us about 10-15 minutes deciding what to eat!!!  Got the baby ribs and steak with fries. The baby ribs were okay and the steak was a bit chewy. However, they totally nailed it with the fries. That includes steak fries, sweet potato fries, etc. Actually now that I think about it, the appetizers are really good here. It was my first time trying the potatoes skin and oh my gosh, it was so good!!!! Crispy skin and bacon on top mmmmmm. I would definitely be coming here just for their appetizers honestly...  The service was just alright. Nothing bad but nothing to be talking about. The only thing was that our server was nowhere to be found when we needed something but ehhhh eventually got what we needed(I sound like a needy bitch). So far, I would still come back and try out their other dishes!

This location is extremely bright! The lighting is so damn bright compared to other Friday's that I've been to. This isn't a good thing! Also, service is extremely slow and the waitresses seem to be extremely clueless about the items on their menu.

I would give it less but not allow too. I work in the food industry so I know when my food has been sitting for awhile before it was sent out to me. My pasta had a layer of dry up cream, my plate was cold to the touch. And worst of all my lady's fires were cold but her plate was hot tell me how does that happened. But worst of all we sat down on a wet table. And really does anybody check up on there guess! Just because we order none refill drink doesn't mean we don't want another drink. I like finish my dish and didn't get a refill. So yeah at the end of the day ain't never eating here, even if my food is for free facing the fact that my food was left out on the warmer long enough to dry out is just bad. And it was NOT even busy for them to have food left out on the warmer that long.

Jack Daniel Daly iron steak is my all time favorite. I don't come for anything else. It does take awhile to get refills though so make sure you ask for a refill every time your waiter or waitress comes to the table. They don't come too often especially when it gets busy.

I'm giving this TGIF two stars. The only reason it get's two is because how cool the bartenders were. The food came out cold, the soup tasted like they made it hours before. I asked for a rare steak and it came out well, what a horrible experience. I hope this TGIF does some major changes!

Great food!!! Great service!!! Def be coming back. Happy hour from 3-7. Caught the tail end of happy hour and got some bomb boneless wings!! Waitress even let us order more half off appetizers a little after 7 so that was cool
My dad and I ate lunch here Friday afternoon and both got food poisoning! Terrible experience we will never be back!

My family and I are visiting California from Texas, we were a little reluctant to try this location due to bad reviews but we were hungry! Well I'm glad we gave it a shot, it was clean and had clean restrooms. The staff was friendly, Mikey took our order and had our table of 4 served in a short time. Jake checked on us throughout our meal and gave us everything we needed. No complaints here!

Had a really fun time Saturday night with family .... Our server ....Michael was so much fun... We had endless apps and Long Island ice teas ...what a blast!!! When you go be sure to ask for Michael he was  attentive and continued the food and drinks coming ... Thanks Michael you made our fun time out the best!!! So remember ... Ask for Michael he is excellent!!!! Went to Friday's again ...I can't say enough about the excellent service Michael gave us we had a blast!!! And delicious food and drinks!!! Thanks Michael ...you're awesome

I must say it was a wonderful experience eating here. I actually was here for dinner yesterday on Saturday 3/19/16. I was here with my dad. We ordered the Jack Daniel Sampler from the appetizer menu. The Baby back ribs were spot on and was delicious to eat with the signature bbq sauce that came with it. The chicken it came with was also really great along with the fried shrimp. The bbq sauce the whole platter came with is probably the best one had so far out of all the ones ive had. Now call me a pig on this one, but i have a good reason to why i did it. There is the Friday's Endless Apps promotion going on which is where you pay $12 for all the unlimited appetizers you want. Of course, that comes with limitations. There are only 9 different appetizers on the Endless's apps menu. You probably can't handle all of them without a few friends (unless youre me.) Oh yeah, and the good reason to why i decided to do this is that i was hungry. Anyway, the way it works is that you eat your first dish, then when youre finished, you order another one, and so on until you're full. We started with the Tucson spinach dip. Now im a bit of a finicky eater and i dont like onions, but the ones in the spinach dip were ground up into a really fine invisible powder thats mixed into the dip. Therefore, i was able to eat it much to my delight. I will say, its better than most spinach dips in that the dip is easier to scoop onto the tortilla chips that come with it. By taste, it tastes slightly better than the one at Dave & Busters and a few other places. Its a bit hard to describe, the only word i could find for it was "delicious." The next thing i got was the mozzarella sticks. I will admit, they were good to eat, but ive had better. Thats my opinion though. Again, im a finicky eater so other people would enjoy it more than me. However to make them more enjoyable, instead of dipping them in the default marinara sauce, use the delicious Jack Daniel Signature BBQ sauce. Makes everything better. The next appetizer we received was the BBQ Chicken Tostada. These are mini round tortilla chips with shredded cabbage and chicken on them. Very delicious. The bbq sauce it came with was very delicious. Im fact, it was the same Jack Daniel signature bbq i just mentioned seconds ago. Note: the tostadas have a dab of mayo on them. This dish was bomb. (The good kind) the next dish was the potstickers. I think these were pork. Anyway, ive had these before at the "Block at Orange" location near to Dave and Busters, and they were much more appealing there, but the ones here were good too. The sauce is good too. Unfortunately, it was not the Jack Daniel Sig BBQ, but hey. You can still try. Now by this time, i started to get full. I ordered the last appetizer which was the baked potato skins. Now i dont bother with the sour cream and onion, but i ate these with the JD Sig BBQ sauce and it was very VERY good. The tostadas were good too. These have bacon and cheese on them like most other places, but they taste way better. Especially with the Jack Daniel Signature BBQ sauce.  So lets talk service. BEST SERVICE IVE HAD SINCE never. Our server's name was Jeremy and he was very polite, enthusiastic, informative. He's a very cool chill guy, makes you feel comfortable and right at home. He checked up on us more than a few times which is excellent service by my standards. All the other servers from other restaurants take 15-20 minutes and only check on you twice. He also brought all the food out much faster than my temper under 5 minutes. Basically, once i finished one of my appetizers, i would basically receive a new one within a split second. If you eat giant plates of food within 5 minutes, this guy is the one for you. If you take 5 hours to eat a lollipop, you best find another restaurant with the nonexistent service. So yes, Jeremy is a wonderful server. Very nice.  Also we came around 7:30 which is a good time if you want it to not be packed with people and faster service. (Although Jeremy is probably fast either way) So i will say, this is my longest review so far and it's very rare i review a place unless its very good. Good job TGI for choosing the location at Westminster mall, very convenient to find food. Much better than the food court. (But the food court is good too. Try Fuji Japan if you like teriyaki)  Have a nice day folks.

Oh my! Surprisingly very good! I had not been to TGI Friday's in forever, but popped in here after some holiday shopping in December. Was pleasantly surprised! Superb service and delicious food. Appreciated the extensive menu and the good beer selection. They do have some of the same menu from what I remember as a child; however, the menu has evolved extensively. I feel like their marketing/PR team could do a lot.. I never hear anything about them, and wouldn't have popped in, except it was the first thing we saw and I was STARVING.
Very good food reasonable price very good customer service I recommended it you should go there on Fridays JK you can go there any day of the week

Love going here! Moved here in November from Indiana, and my husband and I have visited this Friday's at least 4 times. Always great, I don't understand why the stars are so low. We normally sit in the bar and have excellent service. Charles waited on us this time!

*** Curry or Kobe??? (Westminster) ***  My kids wanted to watch some basketball, but there was one problem... One kid wanted to see the final Kobe game, while the other wanted to see the Warriors beat the records or wins in a season. Two great games, but I has a difficult time finding a place showing The Warriors. After calling around TGIF was the place to go.  This made for a great place to bring the kids, watch a game, and enjoy some good food all at the same time. I want to point out that Matt (our host) was very nice in setting us up! Here's what I liked...  * They had the perfect selection of games to make everyone happy :-) * Very family friendly atmosphere to even bring the kids. My other option was either take my kids to a sports bar or a bikini coffee shop. If I had selected either of those options it would have resulted in me getting into deep trouble and a few days sleeping in my truck :-) ha ha ha...  * The food was pretty good. I had fried string beans, Cajun chicken & shrimp, and some oreo desert.  * The host Matt did a super job on the phone and perfect seating for my family! * Easy parking!  Since the Westminster Mall is a bit empty these days it makes for the perfect place for me to go and NOT fight the crowds for parking. Yeah!  Here's what I didn't like... * Hmm... my waitress was a little absent. I'm not going to dwell on it because I had a nice time with my kids :-) Plus I wasn't in a big rush since my kids were enjoying the game.  *********************  Food = good Seating area = very clean  Service = needs improvement for this type of establishment.  Restroom = very clean

Jake is one of the best bartenders here. He is always so friendly and always has the best customer service! My fiancé and I love coming to this location. The only complaint I have is that people are rating this place higher! The people that rate this place under 4 stars are stupid. This is a casual place. I don't understand why they expect 5 star service. Go somewhere else!

Love this Fridays because Jake is a kick ass bartender. Always in a good mood and works hard. He also makes sure our food is on point. As for the Bar Manager; well she shouldn't be one. No personality and she's a B*t*h. An update as of June 8, 2016 just found out the bar manager is gone. What a better place now

Where local libations are concerned this is the place to be for a saucy cocktail and excellent service. You know, eateries such as TGIF can be a toss up as far as "the experience" is considered... One in the same across the board in comparison to any other location, so destination food settings such as these have a tendency of blending with its surroundings in more or less cookie cutter fashion, and to be quite honest, I'm not terribly difficult to please making it even easier to take on a blasé approach to lunch; with that being said people are what make an experience unique, and that is exactly what we found in bartender/server/ delight Michael this afternoon. Thanks to Michael, my friends birthday luncheon was made all that much brighter. The drinks were INCREDIBLE, and his personality out shined even the longest amount of time it took for an appetizer to make it to the table. Thank you Michael. You are a gem. And thanks Westminster TGIF for making our experience one to remember

So to start off, i came to tgif around 11:30am. My grandmother and i were seated right away and were given some time to order. When our server came by i had ordered the chicken and shrimp cajun pasta and she ordered the pizza, for appetizers we ordered crab cakes. After a while we started to realize that they were taking quite long with our order and there were only about 5 other people in the restaurant at this time. Finally our food came out about 40 minutes later. Thats a pretty long time if you ask me. I began eating my pasta, it was quite delicious, so i took in fact the time it mustve taken to make this. After we finished eating, we paid the bill and left. I brought my leftovers with me. When we arrived home i started to feel uneasy a little, and i develpoed a few itchy bumps on my face that started to swell as i scratched them. Soon these bumps began to appear on my whole body, and i went into shock. My body was starting to feel like it was on fire, and then at times is get really bad cold chills. I started to feel light headed with a sensation that i might faint. When my mom came home she asked how i got this and i mentioned what i had eaten, telling her about the pasta. She asked me if it had shrimp in it and i said yes. Right then she knew that what gave me this horrible reaction was the shrimp. Im not allergic to shrimp whatsoever, but she said that the reason why i was in that condition was because of the shrimp. She had had the same experience at another restaurant. This is due to the lack of cleanliness of the shrimp. In other words, the shrimp was not cleaned of its defecations. So tgif heres some advice, clean your damn shellfish. No one should have to experience the pain and irritation i was in. I also advise others to not order anything with seafood, especially shellfish.

Not happy with my shrimp skillet meal at all. The server brings it out and I probably have 1/2 cup of rice fried (stuck ) to the skillet. The shrimp there was probably about 7. Definitely not worth the money! Very unhappy customer!
Everyone is awesome. Food, once it comes is delicious. But from order to eating was over 45 minutes on a NOT busy Thursday evening.  I won't be back with my kids. There was almost a riot!!!

This place is good if you want something tasty and cheap late at night. All the servers I've met Rachel Johnny and I think Jeremy is his name are very friendly and cool. The hostesses are also nice I think Helen and I'm not sure who the other ones names are but this location is awesome shoutout to their manager Alan who is awesome too thanks guys!

Went to have dinner here because we were in the area  the other day and let me start off by saying that we waited 15min to be seated it was a Tuesday night and there was seats open everywhere i could see ....we got seated they took our drink order and we placed our food order as well the food that i can say it took for ever to get it once i got it my hamburger was soaked it was all mushy on the bottom and my wife's pasta was dry you bit into the chicken and it felt like i was biting a piece of cardboard don't know how that would taste but I'm assuming like this chicken .... My boyfriend and I came in for dinner and we had the pleasure of having Christian as our server. He was very knowledgeable on the drinks and food, gave us great recommendations , and most importantly great service! If you're ever able to pick a server when you visit this tgi Fridays ask for Christian! You will not be disappointed with his service. Thank you Christian! Best service we had in awhile.

This place had probably the worst service of any Fridays i have ever eaten at. The server was extremely slow,  forgetful,  and paid almost no attention to the customers. This was the first and last time i will eat at this Fridays. Worst part is the food is decent. I just don't have patience for poor service.

Came in on a Sunday to watch the basketball game. It's all day happy hour on Sunday's, and you can sit anywhere to get the deals! Typically happy hour is only in the bar area.  We were helped by Alexis. She was a very attentive girl. She made sure our drinks were always full, asked if we needed anything else ordered, and would always follow up on our food/drinks to make sure we were satisfied. Wow, what amazing customer service!  This time we came for appetizers and drinks. Everything came out at a reasonable amount of time. The apps tasted great and the drinks were refreshing.  It was a great experience!
Food is ok but service is beyond slow.  30+ minutes to get food at lunch on Saturday.  Waiter didn't seem interested in stopping by the table unless I stared at him.  Can't recommend

I go here many times with my best friend. Everytime we are here, we always enjoy foods & drinks here. I always get the jack daniel chicken strips & a berry smoothie. I sometimes get their berry margaritas there too. Also, there baby ribs are amazing too. Oh shoutout to Elizabeth, shes an amazing waitress. Shes very upbeat & smiles. Shes very on point on everything.

The food sucks. Waitress said the kids meal pizza was pre made. I have a hunch that's not the only thing that is pre packaged. Pasta was tasteless and the chicken was dry. Tgi Fridays is the rite aid of chain restaurants

I was here last week and I just had to leave a five star rating for our waiter Christian. It's so rare to have great service now a days but Christian was amazing.  He gave us space when we needed it, made helpful and informative recommendations when we could not figure out what to order, and all with such a great attitude. He genuinely enjoyed his job which made or experience so nice! You could tell he took pride in his work and although some may say it's just Friday's, this is such an admirable quality in any person. So, great job Christian!! Keep up the great work.

Had a drink and some fries with a girlfriend last night (monday). There were way more people than I expected. I wish that they had a longer happy hour on weekedays, but prices aren't bad to begin with, so I can't really complain.  Drinks were good, fries were the perfect amount of crispy/soft, and the service was great. They didn't check on us too much or too little. I wish I could remember the servers name. He was helping at the bar tables, and he was also behind the bar last night. I really appreciated his honesty about their drinks. His recommendation was great and I really enjoyed my drink.
I honestly love this place the servers are so nice, very energetic and polite. I was always go for happy hour and it's just awesome great place for happy hour.

I ate here on Saturday night which was about two days ago. Our servers name was Michael and he was just nothing short of amazing. He provided great service and made sure that all of our needs were met every step of the way. It was refreshing to get a server like him because customer service doesn't always seem to be at the forefront of restaurants. He is great at what he does and Friday's is lucky to have him as a staff member

Nice location and theme of the restaurant but I do go to TGI Friday allot to the one in la puente, and this TGI was a disappointment the food was really salty, they had really good customer service but the food wasn't good, in sticking to La puente

The service was great but the food was way too salty. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich with fresh baked bread instead of the ciabatta. I ordered blue cheese dressing to dip my fries in and they let me drink my Starbucks with my meal. I sat at the empty bar watching sports and playing on my phone. I just wish the chicken was not as salty. Maybe it was frozen and then deep friend. Fresher is always better people! TGIF can do better than this.

Terrible food and terrible service. My husband and I came here for a lunch break on a Tuesday and it took them 40 minutes to give us our food from the time we ordered it to the time we got it. There weren't really any people in there at the time so I'm not sure why it took 40 minutes. The waitress didn't come by one time besides taking our drink and food order. She wasn't even the one to bring us drinks or food and never came by to ask us if everything was good.  The food on the other hand was extremely disappointing. My husband ordered $12 boneless wings. When they brought it out, there were 6 little wings on the plate. There's no way that plate should cost $12. You can get at least 10 huge wings for $12 at Buffalo Wild Wings. I got the grilled chicken Cobb salad and that was disappointing as well. The lettuce was half frozen and there was absolutely no flavor to the entire salad.  I know where we are never going again.
Food was ok but our server Elizabeth is why I gave it 4 stars. She was really nice and attentive and she even stopped by to ask my son how his dessert was. Thank you Elizabeth!!
My burger bun was frozen on top... now I know they don't have them fresh. Will not be coming back here.

This is without a doubt, the worst Friday's I have ever been to. The hosts were doubling as waiters so it took forever to get a table. We never actually saw our supposed waiter, just the hostess. Good thing we ordered right away when we sat down. The food took forever. Another host came in to check on us, all before the waiter ever came over. Listen to the other reviews and don't come here!

This has become our (my fiancé') regular Friday lunch venue....the service is usually prompt and attentive (in fact several wait staff now regularly recognize and  greets us by name).  The menu is sufficiently varied to appeal to diverse tastes and the quality is usually above average.  When either the food or service had been lagging a quiet word to either the server or, on one occasion, an ass't mgr, has yielded satisfactory results. An unadvertised special worth mentioning is the all you can eat appetizers for $12.00 (there are 6-8 different choices).    There is a separate menu for this special and it must be specifically requested.  The spinach florentine flatbread is especially tasty.  Steve (HB)

Food was mediocre. Ordered the endless appetizers for $10. Got the wings and bf got the mozzarella sticks. The sticks were really cheesy and we're pretty good. I had the ghost pepper wings first and they were literally fire. I enjoyed them! That was about the only food item I enjoyed. It was GREAT. Ordered the 2 for $20 to go and they were super chill about it. Service was great! Food was okay. Cheap food and pretty good deals.

Me and my boyfriend come here during happy hour. Cant beat the half off appetizers. We usually get the traditional wings, fries and mozzarella sticks.. All under $20 cant beat that. As for the entrées, they can be a bit pricey and not all that great

Come to this location very often, servers are okay.  I highly recommend the bar if you come to this location. My first time coming to the bar was the other night & I believe Troy was the one who served me, Fantastic!  Greeted me right away, got my drinks right away, & the food came out quicker than expected & it was excellent!
Worst ever. Spent an hour and a half waiting for food after ordering 2 apps and 2 beers.  Manager knew about it and did nothing. Nearby waitress was yelling at a customer loudly. Never will go back.
The food was delicious our server was awesome very inventive and friendly nice and clean restaurant
I know why they rate a 2 1/4 star here.  The poor waiter run ragged and they chimp out on your food here.  I order haft sandwich and fries and look how many I got???  Mini bag of fries.

Really bad service. It wasn't even that busy took about 15 minutes to even get greeted at our table

Only the mozzarella sticks and wings are worth getting from the menu. However, it takes half an hour for them to arrive to your table. I wondered how they made profit with the $10 endless apps but then I realized that they lag on purpose to discourage anyone from ordering another round. An hour and a half for two rounds of mozzarella sticks, no thanks.
Quality of Service is poor. Sunday, around 8:30pm. Restaurant is not busy. 20+ minutes for drinks, another 15min for soups. Disappointing.

We came here for my birthday dinner. It was 6 adults and 3 kids. We get there and it wasn't very busy. Our server comes, says hello and then walks off. Comes back about 10 minutes later to take our order for drinks. Leaves and about 10 minutes later comes back to give us our drinks. He leaves again. I don't even know how much time went by when he finally comes back. He apologizes since he has another big party. He takes our order and walks away. After some time, 2 other workers bring our food. They don't even know what the orders are. But we figure it out but they brought everyone's food except for MY meal. So we tell them I still need mine and they say they'll go check on it. They leave and no one comes back for about 15 minutes. So finally my father in law gets up, goes to the front to ask for a manager since we don't know where our server is. He talks to a manager and the manager just tells him ok, that they'll get my meal out and I can have any dessert I want. Another 15 minutes go by. At this point, everyone I'm there with to celebrate my birthday is done with their meal!!! So my father in law gets up again and find our server. He tells the server that I still haven't gotten my food. He says sorry and he'll get it out. And guess what, they STILL don't get it out to me. My father in law has to get up a third time. At this point we're all upset and I'm starving! Finally after another 10 minutes or so, my food finally comes out. The manager come to the table and just says "Oh ok. You got your food." Shouldn't she have come out and checked 45 minutes ago when we talked to you the first time?!?!? She asks "What dessert would you like?" She's not even polite and doesn't offer an apology at this point. I finish my meal and they bring my dessert, sing and leave. Everyone at our table, including my kids, are just annoyed at this point. It was just very frustrating having to wait so long especially when we were celebrating my birthday, for my food. After the employees sing and leave, the manager stands there and finally offers an apology. But it wasn't even a real apology. She's looking up at the ceiling, and you can tell she's trying to remember what to say. It sounded so scripted. And what was very upsetting to was that she was blaming the server only. She took no responsibility. Yes, the server could have told someone to cover if he was having a hard time with the other party. But she is the manager! She should be out there making sure the restaurant is running smoothly and if you see your server is busy with one party, help him with his other table. She was being lazy. She knew we were waiting on a plate and didn't make sure it was sent to us. Anyway, they didn't charge us for our dinner but still. The whole thing was so annoying. Thanks for making my birthday dinner a crappy one!

Tracy and Gio are the best combination ! Honestly did an amazing job ! Super  friendly and sweet . They did their best to provide the up most service  (:  First time here and will be coming back ! Food was amazing as well and served super fast!

Shout out to Gio and Tracy! (hope i spelled their names right). My coworkers and I had such a great time thanks to them two! They treated us so good! Our food arrived faster than we expected and overall we all had an amazing night. The food was really good, they played music that I couldn't stop dancing to, and the service was great! I can't wait to come back and when I do i'm definitely asking for them!  Thank you so much guys! We had a blast!

bad bad bad if you want to waste your money and throw AWAY  it in the trash come here..MY experience expensive meals , tasteless , fishy seafood ,no food  presentation alcoholic drinks taste like water (minus well get water)  and rude service what else can you ask for?! ..I should have had  stick with my original plan go to mall food court area much better and way cheaper ...FAIL!! shame on you TGIF
Forgot we've been here before. Then we remembered "oh yeah, we told ourselves never come back ".   Cold food.

I've been here once. And I could give it another try. To be perfectly honest, it's very similar to Applebee's  (got the same vibes and one same deal too). I don't remember what I ordered (LOL) but I remember my mom got something called the "Grilled chicken with jade sauce", something like that. She liked that in the side dish options there were steamed veggies. For the appetizer, we got mozzarella sticks/rectangles? They were pretty bomb and had seasoning! Plus..they sprinkled some more cheese on the top, LOL! The service was pretty good. My mom and I went around 2:30 so there were only a few people there. I had to go to my job at 4 so the server was kind enough to make sure the food would be out asap!  That is great service! The only thing "bad" that happened was that he forgot to bring out the drinks. We couldn't really eat more than half of the appetizer because we didn't have a drink to wash it down. But it's okay, he was still an excellent waiter!

I don't know why everyone complains on the service! I think the customer are the ones who have attitudes!  We come at least every other month and the service has been fine! Angel is our favorite server! Very friendly, upbeat and fast! Love the appetizer deal! The Oreo dessert is so yummy! But, didn't care for the cheesecake.  I saw across the way the bartender mix the drinks, he was generous with the alcohol.  The bathrooms always clean.  We we continue to come back!

Chris was are waiter he was the bomb came to check up on us make sure everything was good the food was great but I must say I haven't had that type of service in a while thank you Chris you do a awesome job me and my boyfriend talk about how great your service was when we step out

Me and my friends go and always get a brownie obsession they never miss a time to be rude and rush you the food isn't great they half answer ur questions wouldn't recommend. Last night they gave us cups with junk on them and a scoop of ice cream with a bigger ice cube on it than the ice cream

I hesitantly revisited this place.. O.M.f.n.G.. Yeah, I ordered the cheese burger sliders for $1.50 each... The meat was thin, and dry...  Kind of like it was precooked hours beforehand, and then cooked again before being served.. I also ordered the nachos grande.. There was absolutely nothing "grande" about it.  It was small..  Like a 2 person appetizer serving at best..  No wonder it was "half price".. There is an old saying "you get what you pay for"..  But because restaurants need repeat business to stay afloat, that excuse is irrelevant. With many other restaurants improving their food quality, I am predicting TGIF will go out of business or sell out to another business entity in the near future.. That's if they don't fix their food issues..  But more than likely, they probably feel, they have no food issues..  And that is why they will go under.

I guess I had some higher expectations but went to Friday's with the family and I thought the service was horrible and took forever. I orders a Rib eye for $24.00 and it came out with 1/2 of of it fat and a very small cut. The only good thing at Fridays is the Drinks and the appetizer if I'm at the bar.

I really enjoy TGI Fridays- they have great food, great deals, a rewards program, and this location is SUPER convenient. I went to the mall yesterday to trade in some books at book off, and stop in at best buy. I was a bit hungry and it was happy hour...and omg happy hour on a Saturday! Nobody does that! There was no wait for a table and I was able to order 2 appetizers at half price, and a margarita all for under 20 bucks. I also was able to get away from all the Saturday night mall holiday shopping craziness. The staff was friendly and attentive..kept checking to see if I need anything or refills. I really really like TGI Friday's being in the mall.

So sad. I was really excited to get some mozzarella sticks tonight. I'll make this really simple. My girlfriend and I walked in here to have some dinner and were seated immediately because it wasn't very busy. After being seated, we browsed the menu for about ten minutes before realizing we haven't even been greeted by our server yet. We looked around to find someone but there wasn't any employees in sight. We set the clock for another Ten more minutes just to give the place a chance. Ten more minutes went by and we were over it at this point. Before walking out, we stopped at the hostess to let her know that another table had been seated and she should probably let the server know that she had tables. She looked into the restaurant and said "thanks". So we left. Won't be returning. Service is a joke  The next time I want some mozzarella sticks, I think I'd rather drive the extra 15 minutes to their location in Orange.
Ryan in his red button up and vest was the greatest bartender ever !!! Mojitos are his specialty. Come in and have a drink

POOR SERVICE:  My order was completely wrong. Due to dietary restrictions I  ordered grilled salmon with no seasoning no butter and spinach, no cheese or seasoning.  Salmon came dripiping in butter and lots of salt.  Spinach was covered in cheese and seasoned.  Our waiter did not come back for 20 minutes. I finally just ate it (it was after 9 pm- I.was starving!).  He said he put it in correctly but the cooks are  always messing up.
