Ordered food here tonight for pick-up. I had the order repeated to me twice during the phone to make sure they got everything (it was about seven items). I arrived, and they got two items wrong, which was slightly expected for how large the order was. Then they got another item wrong again when they were almost done making the food. Then again. At this point, I thought it was ridiculous. As for the food, the side dishes were literally in a tiny white container that was half the size of other TGIF's. We were very disappointed. For the main entrees, the way they packed our order led to many of the juices dripping out of the containers into the bag, which made the containers soaked along with the packages of utensils. Another icky issue. For the four smoothies we ordered, they did not even have a cup holder for them. Food tasted okay, but as far as ordering for pick-up from here, please don't come here.
Meal and drinks on Christmas were great however they charged my card twice for the meal and now I'm left arguing with them to give my $ back. Will not be returning.

$10 bottomless apppetizers!!  I've never been to a TGIFridays before so we stopped in. The place is pretty big and for some reason I felt like I was in Vegas lol. We ordered the parmasean chicken which was pretty damn good. The mac & cheese that came with it is terrible though. The bf opted for the bottomless apps. He started off with a full order of parm wings which were "meh". All the orders after that come in half size which is great so you can get a taste of everything. Chicken flatbread was blah wouldn't get that again. The potato skins were awesome and so were the Jack Daniel wings. Sign up for their newsletter online and get a coupon within minutes for a free dessert or app.
The waitress was really nice, so were the pretzels. The two kids meals we got were awful 0/10 would not recommend.

Oh my. First, shout out to Alan, the manager on duty on the day we came in. He deserves recognition for his efforts.  My niece and I came here after shopping - neither of us had eaten so we were hella hungry. It was rather empty so I figured we wouldn't have to wait long to get our grub on. We were seated immediately by a less than friendly hostess. Our server was very nice and was very swift with our drinks and taking our orders.  This is where things go south. After waiting at least 20 minutes for our food, I ask the hostess to check on our order. Her reply: "I'm busy right now but I'll see what I can do". Really? So, I immediately go from hungry to hangry. Long story short, I find out that our order was never entered into the system. After about 5 minutes, our food arrives. My niece had the chicken strips and fries and I had the parmesan chicken. The chicken was hella salty while the mac & cheese was hella bland.  The manager definitely made us whole as a result of the experience. That said, that hostess needs customer service training. Soon.  It goes without saying that I will not return.

It was a family day for me and my family we decided to stop by at TGIF. We were craving the green beans  one of my favorites but as we entered we waited to be seated the bartender just looked at us but didn't bother to help us he just walked the other way. Never have we  experienced this bad service.
Great waitress..super friendly...we had BOGO dinner....good music...nice atmosphere too
Horrible service we had to keep asking for the waitress she only checked up on us once in one hour service is definitely way better at the TGIF in orange at The Block. Never coming here again.

I went to TGIF for dinner and one of our guest was denied cocktails because their drivers license was vertical. While I recognize that they have the right to do this, it is a bad business practice. Won't be visiting again, hope you don't upset too many patrons before you change this policy. Farewell.

We came in on a Friday night to celebrate my sisters B-day. All 5 of us ordered an entree and an appetizer to share. I have heard a nasty rumor that all their food is previously made, then frozen and they just put it in the oven or the microwave to heat it up. I didn't want to believe it but I'm pretty sure it's true. My dad ordered a steak that he said tasted like a foot ball...chewy and no flavor. I ordered a chicken sandwich that tasted OK. (I only ate half) All of our entrees came out at the same time with no silverware. Shortly after we received the entrees the appetizer came out. Shouldn't an appetizer come out before the entrees? Then we sat and looked at our food for at least 10 minutes with no silverware. We asked 3 different people for silverware and finally someone brought us some. Just overall not a great experience. I've never been a huge fan of TGI Fridays but this just confirmed why. We wont be coming back.

Good thing about this location is that its more mellow, no ridiculously loud music. I ordered the endless apps, my bf ordered the 10 ounce new york strip. He enjoyed his meal, but the portion was small for $25. It came with 2 small scoops of mash and a little fries. The endless apps, none of it was good. It was just ok. Even the boneless wings were just ok. The crispy green beans, were too oily. This is my second time giving TGIF a chance, and I will say this, I will never come back. This is all I heard from the waitress literally the whole time I was there, what drinks do you want//want a refill//how are you paying? No, how are you doing, thank you, none of that, not even a tiny smile. The overall was not great for a place where you tip, and yes we did tip even though i felt like she didnt deserve a tip, but i decided to tip because you never know what a person is going  through or if theyve had a rough day.

It's my fault for getting my expectations up. This place is essentially a happy hour burger joint. I should have come for a burger and I'd probably be thrilled, but in my infinite wisdom I opted for the steak and lobster with sweet potato fries and mac and cheese as sides.  It arrived on a plate for grown ups which only served to emphasize the lack of fries, and the children's portions of steak and lobster.  The steak was small enough it would take 3 more to equal the patty of a grown up burger.  The lobster was so small it made me regret choices I've made in my life that led me to this moment. The sides looked ok, but I could count the number of fries on both hands.  The sides tasted fine (it's hard to screw up mac n cheese unless you're BWW) but the steak... actually let's call it what is, a thick slider. The slider should have been medium rare, but came medium well, and was oddly flavorless on one side. I've never known beef to be devoid of flavor, but somehow they managed to remove it. Well half of it anyway. The lobster was about the size of a couple chicken fingers, tasted more like crab than lobster, and clung to its shell in a way that would make crab jealous.  This alone might make me vegetarian. The saving grace was my server Denise who was great and would get 5 stars if this was just for her.  I should have gotten a burger, or drunk. At least I used a gift card so it didn't feel as bad paying.
Only came because it was open. Should've just stayed home. Everything about it was horrible. Don't ever go to a restaurant attached to a mall.

So I come here with 2 other people after some skating down at Fountain Valley Skate Center. We are all hungry and its late but they are open till midnight, and I was craving pot stickers, so I thought might as well come.  - Sat at the bar and while the service was 'good' there was plenty of times when I felt ignored. Which is why the rating isn't a 4 or 5 star. The food was good and the $10 bottomless appetizers are amazing.  - I would come here again if I'm around and if I'm hungry. But I would hope to feel a little more welcomed vs ignored except when really catching a persons eye.

Happy hour! Great deal for happy hour here. Drinks are inexpensive and appetizers are half off along with 1.50 fries and sliders. The food isn't too bad here. The other night I ordered sizzling chicken and shrimp entree and it was quite tasty. They also have a reward program that has great perks if you plan to come often. The only reason I knocked off a star is because sometimes the service have be extremely slow. Even when the restaurant only has a couple of tables after 10 pm

The only good thing that occurred was the nice roomy booth my husband and I had all to ourselves. The lobster- SALTY. The fries- SALTY. The steak- LEATHERY and over cooked. Presentation- SUCKED and way unappealing. I'd be more pissed if I didn't have a coupon! Don't bother eating here..the cook needs to go!
Yes folks a hair in the loaded potato skins and it's disgusting the manager Chris just gave us a free app or dessert on the next visit !!! Why would I come again ?!?!  GROSS!!!
We come here almost every Friday. although she seems super busy Valerie was a very nice server. The food and happy hour menus is always perfect.

This is my first visit to this  TGI Friday's & likely my last . Many of the other Fridays locations are located at malls this one is in the mall. We arrived at 3 PM on a Sat , parking was available if you did not mind a walk. We were greeted promptly and seated our selves at the bar. It has at least 4 big flat screen TVs all tuned to sports. Menus were available on stands at the bar but our bar tender brought more . We had to request the " endless apps" menu the bar and restraint are modern & well maintained. Unfortunately the bar has a stain beer aroma that creeps up on you as you wait for food. It is not overpowering but far from present. The loaded potato skins are not even half loaded . Some lacked any Bacon overall the plate was sloppy and showed a lack of care in preparation. The cheese sticks were ok . The meat balls were good not great. The drinks were served in mason jars smaller than the pint glad I am familiar with at most TGI Fridays service was slow but friendly. I mentioned that I would not order the potato skins again and was told that it is sort of you get what you pay for. I was also warned that the flat bred is if he at this location. Never did get my loyalty points despite asking.

This location is usually not to busy , came here on Thursday night for dinner it was not busy at all. The waitress seemed to be very nice and helpful but she was not obviously trained right . First she never gave us utensils or Napkins the food looked unappetizing and Ten minutes in between drinks of when it was done !! Nice waitress just no specialty in service oh and the food was terrible cold and soggy.

We always love a good Friday's appetizer night, however, our server last night ruined it. Our server was horribly inattentive to us and our food took almost 25 minutes to come out when all we ordered was appetizers. The server was too busy flirting with the men at the table behind us to notice we hadn't even gotten our drinks when their food arrived. Note they arrived just after us and were served much faster than us after ordering the same items. The food was 4 stars and the service was 2. The two stars were not earned by our server, but by the server for tables nearby who refilled our drinks because we were waiting so long.
Food was ok. But the service was horrible. I literally waited 30 mins to pay! I had to ask for a check then my card just sat there. Not worth the hassle.

Even though they aren't busy, this place has one of the slowest service ever! My friends and I use to go here after basketball because it was usually the only place that is open really late. They have happy hour after 9PM which includes half-off appetizers and cheaper alcoholic beverages. We came in on a Sunday night, and there wasn't anybody to seat us. I think there were only 3 waiters including 1 at the bar, and no host or hostess. We waited in the lobby until one of the shift leads noticed us. We sat down and the waiter got our drink orders. They said they would come back and take our food orders right away but I guess they meant in another 20 minutes. Once we placed our orders, the food took awhile to come out.  We ordered from the happy hour menu which included potato skins, Jack Daniel traditional wings, Chicken nachos, sesame jack strips, hamburger sliders, and spicy fried chicken sliders (new). The traditional Jack Daniel wings was good and meaty but it was lacking sauce. We asked for more Jack Daniel sauce and refills for water. They came back with the refills and forgot the sauce. The potato skins were crispy and delicious, however, the chicken nachos didn't seem fresh; the guacamole seemed like it has been out for awhile. And the sliders were okay; the spicy chicken was full of flavor while the hamburger one was dry and plain. The sesame jack strips are usually really good here, but today, I didn't taste that much meat and more of the flour. We got the bill and they charged us for the extra Jack Daniel sauce which they never told us they would. Once we gave them our card to process the payment, it was such a long wait to get the card back. I saw our waiter actually setting up tables with utensils rather than processing our card.  Overall, the food is okay. I felt like the food was rushed to come out that it wasn't as fresh as it could be. Great service is not something to expect at this location especially when it's NOT busy. You would think the service should be better with no customers but they work the opposite.

This place looks nice but the service and food was mediocre. Our waiter was "loaded" he said so himself...he would forget what we ordered a few times and will not wait on us properly with drinks and providing utensils. Do not order endless appetizer unless youre prepare to spend quite some time there.

Came here on a Monday night expecting decent service on a long and oversue date with my lover.... I recommend to come here if you are alone or don't expect mediocre service. Don't even remember the bartender's name, but that's  ok because I'd rather serve myself than remember this loser's name. TGI Fridays somewhere else if you want the experience!

The waitress was attentive and the food was good and came out in a timely manner. The kids enjoyed coloring while they waited. A little expensive so we don't go often, but when we do it's a nice environment.

If there was a half star they'd get that and the only reason they'd get half a star is because the hostesses are great they are very sweet. But as for the service it is by far the worst I've had.  The reason why is that we sat in the bar area and the server walked by and said "I'll be right with you" and after 15 minutes passed he never came back so one of the hostesses went to find him and spent a good few minutes looking for him. So we asked to change tables and after setting a timer for 5 minutes and no one even acknowledging us. We went to talk to the manager and Chris (who was presented to us as the manager) didn't really seem to care what we were telling him about. And the reason why. He was the keyholder NOT a manager. The reason that we were not waited on was becaue "they were swapped" when there wasn't even half the tables full in the restraunt. I am very disappointed. I doubt I will ever step a foot in to this TGIFridays ever again.

For being a Saturday it wasn't that busy at all. My husband and I got the nachos for an appetizer and they took about 30 mins to bring them out and 10 mins later we got our entrees. The fact that we had to wait 30 min for appetizer was pretty long for not being busy. The shrimp Cajun pasta wasn't that spicy and it had like 5 shrimps that's pretty ridiculous. I will think twice before coming back

My 2nd time to this location. My first time was good but not this 2nd time around. Shrimp cocktail was not fresh, the tails have started turning dark and started smelling like things you'd rather not put in your mouth. Complained and the chef came out to start explaining how the shrimp came in just the same morning and therefore must be fresh - maybe it indeed came in the same day but still, it wasn't fresh. Chef then took it back. No apologies or anything. Waiter was cooler, he mistakenly recommended a dish that was a special priced for weekdays (went there on a weekend) but was still able to honor the weekday special price eventually. So it was kind of a half steal. There has been a few flies humming around while I ate which I'd rather not have. The food was good. Overall expected more from a TGI Friday than what I got. There definitely is room for improvement.

Worst steak and shrimp ever!  The steak was so tough I couldn't cut or chew it. The shrimp was small and dry nothing like the photo on the menu!  My berry Sangria was so sweet there was no way even one ounce of wine in it.  The service was so so but this place has horrible food. My son got their hot wings, his favorite and he said they were just ok. Who screws up bar food?  Add on top of it the noise level in this place and you have a rotten dining experience!  I never go to TGIFs and now I remember why.  I thought I'd give it a try since this one is fairly new and I hadn't been to Friday's in years; and only been about 4 times in my life.  Bad choice!  I wish we would have went with our old favorite, Outback across the way!   And not that cheap $25 for a crappy tough tiny steak and 6 tiny dry shrimp.  Outback is a way better value for the same price for sure and it's good food.  Heck Sizzler or Applebees is better for that matter!  Never going to a TGIF's again!

Hostess was super friendly and we were seated immediately upon arrival.  Ordered some happy hour apps and a drink- including some sliders (only $1.50 each) fries and the new spinach queso dip (1/2 off during happy hour). I rate this 4 stars because the spinach dip wasn't that great. It was mediocre. I did enjoy the fries and sliders, but how can you go wrong with that?  The drink my friend ordered was the strawberry ultimate margarita and she loved it. It was strong and sweet. Overall very refreshing! Comes in a cute mason jar. Pretty big for $6.25!  Our server was friendly and attentive. Made sure we were doing okay throughout the meal.  Read other reviews about slow service and I think they have stepped it up since!!! Definitely not bad service!!!  Will be back, for happy hour:)  Place was clean and easy location to access. TGIF!

Been coming here twice a month for the last few months. Today was the worse service well no service at all. The place was half empty and they sat my gf , my baby girl, and i in the very back. We sat there for 15 min and not one person came up to us to take our drink order. If it was busy i would understand but i saw 3 other table come in after us and they got their drinks right away. We just walked out and headed over to Outback

I like to give food places second and sometimes third chances but after that their out and this is now one of those places! This was the third and last time I will be coming here. The first time coming here after an hour+ waiting for our food we just left, the second time I had hair in the center of my burger and needless to say I lost my appetite.... then tonight we tried them once more and the food took over 45 mins and everything was cold Or not fully cooked.... I will never be back here! I really wanted to give them a 0!

Yelp needs to add "less than one star" rating. This restaurant was astonishing bad. My sister, niece, fiancee and I went here today and if you're reading this considering a visit, please read on... We get to the restaurant and the hostesses could not have been nicer! We immediately get seated and wait. And wait. And wait. 10 minutes after sitting down, a server swoops by saying "I'll be with you in a minute". So we wait, wait, wait and wait some more. About 20 minutes of waiting was enough. No drinks, no orders taken, no kiss my ass, nothing. We got up and started to leave. One of the hostesses apologized up and down and sat us at another table. We notice the server for this section take notice of us. We wait. And wait. And wait some more. After nearly 10 minutes, again without ANY server contact, we get up to leave. I'm kinda pissed at this point and ask for a manager. Yet another 5 or so minutes pass and this sloppily dressed guy comes out, listens to me tell him about the service and he could not have cared less. We left. The guy wasn't even a manager, just a "key-holder". The place wasn't busy. Not seemingly understaffed, just inept. Save yourself some time and go elsewhere. Also, see my review about TGIFriday's Long Beach Location. 180 degree opposite.

Wow! That's all I can say.  The prices have skyrocketed and the food has gone WAY down hill. I am in absolute shock how bad the food was. I got the new Mediterranean Shrimp Naan. The naan was burnt, it was sloppy and filled with wilted warm lettuce that covered up the 4 pieces of shrimp. It came with maybe 9 French fries. The sweet potato fries were actually really good.  My boyfriend got the steak and lobster, we were speechless at the portion size of the steak and lobster, with a tiny ball of mashed potatoes. The mac n cheese side looked edible, but it was not! Not creamy whatsoever and super bland. Beyond disappointed at the quality of the food and the price increase. Prices are similar to Cheesecake Factory and they are not even in the same universe.  1 star because the server was really good.
Service was Good. But  when you have to wait forever its not fun. Food size was sad on the chicken strips. Looked like kid size meal. Wont be back.

Even tho I love TGI  Fridays this location was a disappointment , there's wasn't so much people as usual in other locations so we went in and just for our drinks it took over 20minutes , we ordered food right away and no lie it took over an hour to get our food . No attention to us the customers what so ever . Service was just horrible , no wonder it's rating is so low  we try to give places a chance but this was a mistake . The food was good

I've been coming here for a couple for a of years . I Always sit at the bar. best Service  By Mike and Jake always greeted with a smile always on top of their game .Mike makes a killer Old Fashion and Makers Lemonade all I have say ask for Mike or Jake Behind the bar . best service from any other T.G.I  Fridays .Awsome Drinks Great Food almost always a Happy Hour going on and specials.

So I came here kinda late about 10:30. Just wanted to grab a quick bite. Waited 20 mins and asked the bartender if the kitchen was closed. He said no yet the waitress kept staring at me as she was busy cleaning up and attending 4 people. Total wait time 48 mins. I took off. Don't come here before 9 I suppose.

Long wait to be seated, food took twice as long as it should, small portions, staff is mostly high schoolers who either stand around not working or don't have a clue how to serve. Drinks were refilled with what ever and not what we ordered.  Had to ask twice for ranch dressing.  Lastly, overpriced.  Bonus,  the check comes with threes options for tip starting at 18% and as high as 20 something %.  Ha!!! Yeah right.  Never coming back.

Horrible service!! Sat in a booth in the bar and was totally ignored by the staff that walked past us several times. After 15 minutes I stopped a server that was walking past us for the third time and asked for some menus. She brought them and went back to ignoring us. After 30 minutes we still hadn't even been asked for our drink order (sitting in the bar mind you) so we left and went to Cheesecake Factory where we received great service. My family and I have been to this Fridays several times in the past but we will not be going back.

I've been here many times even when it's crowded but tonight it was Terrible. Hostess at door was trying to sit people and bus tables at same time. Took awhile to get seated when I noticed lots of empty clean tables. Took long time for food to come out and wasn't as good as normal. Very dissatisfied

Order a steak with lobster tail from here thru grub hub.  Steak was cooked perfectly to how it was ordered, lobster was wonderful  and the lemon pepper steamed broccoli was outstanding. Also ordered a coke and milkshake. Will continue ordering from here.

Came into TGI Friday today and had excellent service Ryan was our waiter and was awesome he was very nice and gave us excellent service. Me and my girlfriend asked if it was possible to use our free appetizer coupons together. Ryan asked Alan if it was possible and he said he would make it work. These two guys were awesome and very helpful. Will definitely be returning here again. That's guys for your help.

Frank was a great server!  He provided us great custoner service and our food came quickly.  One of us ordered all you can eat apps and I thought i would be waiting on my boyfriend to finish eating,  and that each ap would take 10 minutes to come,  but that didn't happen.  Our server asked each time he brought an app what was wanted next.  My jack daniels full stack of ribs,  mashed potatoes,  and lemon butter broccoli was tasty!  So delicious and served warm and fresh.   We came before happy hour ended and got a mixed drink for only $4.25. I am a rewards member for tgi fridays and I love the point system here.  I'll be redeeming points next time for sure and will definitely return to this location.
Servers are super helpful and friendly. The server that repeats the order to you is the best!!! Accuracy at its finest!

This is about my visit last friday. I came in with my sister to have dinner after a shopping trip at the mall. We both work at restaurants, and we both commented on how well everyone was doing their jobs. We later learned that the hosts name was Alexandra and she lent me a pen, which is unheard of in the restaurant business . She made sure that ee knew our table was almost ready. And even though i knew she was busy as hell, she kept calm and sat us very efficiently. Our server was Chas and she was amaaazing  we ordered spinach dip, a steak, and were going to get dessert, but something personal happened to me. They swiftly got boxes for us and allowed me to keep my dignity, lol. We had paid our check,but continued picking at our food. Chas stopped by and got me two separate refills for coke even though we had already paid our ticket.  The busser was so on it! He was really cute too for the record. Everyone was very gracious and helpful. I really appreciated it, obviously lol I'm writing this review almost a week after i dined. It was by far the best dining experience I've ever been a part of at a TGI Fridays location. I used to frequent the Long Beach Town center location, but now I look forward to coming back to this store. Thank you Chas and Alexandra!
Nice place for a quick lunch with the children, while waiting for auto service. Our server was attentive and accommodating.
Way better service than the one at the Block of Orange. I will leave it at that...

My brother and I came to this TGI Friday's with a $25 gift card in hand.  We went all out and ordered a several dishes to share.  The restaurant wasn't crowded (it was a Thursday in the early evening) and our waiter was friendly and super attentive.  The food was good (as chain restaurant food goes), but not mind blowing or anything special.  It was more than a bit expensive for what were essentially simple dishes. We ordered: - The sampler: the fried shrimp was super yummy, the ribs were very good and tender. The chicken nuggets - well, they weren't so good; too much breading, I felt like I was eating toasted bread. The sauce it all came with wasn't good either.  - Traditional chicken wings with buffalo sauce: It was good and meaty. The sauce needed more flavor and spice.  - Chicken and shrimp pasta:  This dish didn't do a lot for me, but my brother loved it. - Sizzling chicken and shrimp with mashed potatoes: Very good; filling, and flavorful.  My favorite dish of the evening. Bottom line: Decent chain-quality food, good atmosphere and attentive staff.  The cost for what you get is a little pricey, but just what you might expect from this type of chain restaurant.

We are here at the TGIF restaurant in the Westminster mall! We first ordered a shrimp cocktail for an appetizer had to return it it was so dried out and tasted so bad we were afraid to eat it! Our server tried to get us drinks but it took forever the bartenders were taking forever to make the orders! Order dinner it was terrible I ordered salmon so dry spinach was awful kept having to swat nits that were flying around! Husband had steak and salmon steak taste was old and salmon was also dry! Would definitely not recommend any one coming here. Food is terrible our server tried to help us but everything else was a disaster! Don't waste your money it is so not worth it!!!!

Five guys went there for dinner. Horrible service. Food not hot, barely warm. Couldn't seem to get our drinks right. Baked potato tasted funny. Manager took wrong orders back but didn't erase from tab. Never again!

Let me start with the caveat that restaurants have off days. One of the Burgers was supposed to be medium but was closer to rare. Two of our party did the endless apps. Sure the promotional $10 deal is over, however the service should not be conditional. The first round took 20 minutes to arrive. Each subsequent reorder was way too slow. If you at trying to ween your customer base off this menu item...just take it away completely and not make it like pulling teeth. These were the most pressing issues worth mentioning. This is the closest location to us, so let's hope next time is better.

A repeat performance of good food and service for a hungry family of 4 adults and 3 kids.  We were seated right away at a very comfortable long table and our server , Denise, immediately let us know that she would be getting our drinks and then start off getting the kids orders.  We liked that because we didn't want the kids to play with that thingy on the table.  Their food selections came out quickly and now the adults made their choices. Our food was well prepared and Denise had help from kitchen staff so we could all eat at the same time.  I didn't hear any complaints about the food nor the service.  We ended with scrumptious and shareable desserts such as the Vanilla Bean cheesecake, the Whiskey cake, the Oreo madness.  The final tally was big, but we don't do this very often and the smiling faces was well worth the price.

I used to love TGI Fridays I'm really disappointed in the one in Westminster they were known for their potato wedges the ones I got on Sunday were awful the barbecue chicken salad that I ordered looked nothing like the picture on the menu and it had raw pieces of chicken at least I think it was chicken buried under this salad weird. I brought it up to the manager and she took care of it . Staff and our waitress was nice but I don't think I'll be going back.

Great happy hour from 3pm-7pm Monday-Saturday and all day Sunday. Got the pot stickers and boneless wings for half off. They were alright. They weren't really hot (temperature wise) so they didn't feel fresh, so that was a bit disappointing. I also felt like there were an unusual amount of knats (small flyinf bugs) in the bar area. Friendly staff so that's a plus!

There's gnats the food took CENTURIES AND THERES ONLY ABOUT 10 booths taken!! The food is plated horribly My Fridays shrimp are Ever so small and just krispy and dead I wasted an entire steak and lobster meal but I will give one star to ERIN our server and the second to SAM the manager
Why are the endless aps $14 when they are advertised $12 No good reason and a little misleading  Aps were good but we won't return

The downside -- There were 2 or 3 gnats flying around us the entire time we ate. The good side-- we had this awesome waitress Chas. She was super nice and really friendly. I think we would come back to sit in her serving area again. I got a coconut mai-tai and I was to die for. ‍

Great food, excellent ambiance! Bad service. This is a real nice location.  I've been here several times because it's convenient.  The food is amazing and the only problem I have is that it might take some time to get a waiter or waitress to come and take your order. Service is also a slow.  Also, it takes time to get your food.  I constantly have to try to flag down a server but it's hard when they don't come pass you a lot.  I know it's big but like Anais H. said in her review, it wasn't crowded, so no excuse.   Anyways, I don't like the service here.  Too bad, because if the service was better I would definitely come here more often.  As for now, I don't think I will.  I would most likely go somewhere I  will be served better and not have to constantly try to get the server's attention.  Sometimes, when the wait is way too long I make an excuse from the table and go find a server and tell them I need to be waited on.  Hey if you had to wait for 20 or more minutes for food or getting your order taken, what would you do?  I normally would leave but when you are with an elderly person that doesn't want to walk, it's hard to do that.   My advice to your manager is to make sure you are checking with your customers and making sure they are happy and train your servers to check up on their customers once in a while and get their order and food on the table as fast as they can.  If there is a problem or it's taking longer than it should, the server should come back to the table and just let the customer know you are still working on the food and it will be there soon.  Offer free bread or refill their drinks.  Do something to show that the customer is important.  Or they might just walk out.

The waitress was good but she should have mentioned our food would take over 20 minutes. They ran out of shrimp. The ribs were dry and the barbecue sauce was just brushed on there lightly. As if it was done after they were grilled. The salad was the best part of my dinner. The waitress said we couldn't use our coupon on their specials.  What specials it's their new menu items. Who had the bright idea to send out a mailer to advertise their new menu items and include coupons, if they can't be used? The manager agreed to a partial discount. Not good enough. Now I remember why I was never crazy for TFI Friday.

We came here for a Friday dinner and were disappointed by the limited options available for the unlimited appetizer special deal.  However, we were happy with our orders.  Food was fresh, satisfying, & my daughter liked the Mac n cheese.  I'd return to try the other items on their grill menu.  My only other complaint is we never got the extra utensils I requested for my daughter, no water refills, and our food came out before we got utensils.

The worst ever. Very rode server, waited 2 hours for our order while the restaurant was almost empty. No utensils, napkins! Food was burnt, coleslaw was bad and rotten. Please watch when you eat there always smell your food cause we ended up with food poisoning.

Wonderful service I got a piece of foil on one of my dressing the manager Misha kindly went to our table apologize to us about the incident and got the burger on the house what a kind thing to do I have been to so manny places and no manager ever done something like this to me highly recommend this place 100%

3 stars because it's Fridays, 5 because of service from Christian! (Ave. 4) I go into this location out of convenience as it's walking distance from my house and their happy hour is unbeatable. The bartender that helped me Sunday night was very friendly and helpful. My steak was way overcooked but he took care of it without any complaints. Just a super nice guy. Hopefully someone reads my review and Christian gets credit for this because he was awesome.

This place had horrible food that probably came out of the microwave. Our server was not interactive and rushed us. Overall, it was a bad experience paired with HORRIBLE food. We ordered mac n cheese, ribs, and the sirloin steak. Everything was too salty and dry. Would give it zero if i could

My mom and I went this past Saturday for lunch and it was a very disappointing the type of serve we had. We sat in the bar area and our server Blake came over took our drink order and then came back with them and we had told him we need a few more mintues to look at the menu. Well it turned out to be 25 mintues later Blake came back to take our order. Also it was disappointing when my mom told the host that our server never came back to us to take our order they never got once the manager to help us out at all. Instead the manager was too busy sucking up at the table across from us because they had dirty silverware vs. Our server was gone for 25 minutes not taking our order.......smh. TGIF needs to have better customer service over there and let's just say I am never coming back to this location again.

We came here on a Saturday night at about 6:30, wait wasn't bad about 20 minuets we had 2 small toddlers with us and wanted to get their food out quickly we ordered an app drinks and kids meals it took about 15 minuets we then ordered our food a drink was forgotten so we had to go to the bar to ask for it out waitress was no where to be found. After placing our dinner order we waited for about 40 minuets at that point I had to go back to the bar and ask for a manager. This is probably the least interesting place that one will ever eat at. Westminster Mall does not have a lot of interesting food choices, but Westminster/Huntington Beach in general does have amazing food. Do yourself a favor, leave the mall, and drive a few minutes down Bolsa or up Beach to get some delicious Vietnamese/Lebanese/Mexican/Chinese/Thai/Japanese/Italian/French/Persian/German/Indian food. Skip this dump. My friend and I arrived at about 6:30 PM, we were greeted kindly and told that happy hour was until 7 pm. Our server was super sweet, checking on us and refilling our water glasses and lemonade. But, the food was disgusting. I ordered a French onion soup, and a side salad, and my companion ordered some cheesecake. My salad consisted of limp lettuce, some shredded cheese, two tiny cherry tomatoes, and three croutons. The tables had no silverware. Our food was flavorless and boring. This particular location has touchscreen iPads, which would be great if they actually were functional. Our credit cards were not working when we tried to pay so we asked the server to help us out, which was fine. But what is the point of having such technology when it is useless? And forget about going there with old people; I am tech savvy and great with swiping. My companion can barely see, so I handled the payment stuff. I cannot imagine elderly people/grandparents/blind folks eating here and dealing with non functional iPads. I will say that the onion rings are delicious, but we were not served the supposedly stellar barbecue dipping sauce that is supposed to come with them. My friend had a slice of cheesecake that looked tiny and boring. She didn't even finish it. It was nearly $8! We would have been better off driving to Cheesecake Factory down the road. Our meal was overpriced and crappy. But the staff is nice. My stomach is hurting a few hours later. Two thumbs down.
